Variables

HANDLE g_DeviceHandle
 Holds the global handle of device which is used to send the request to the kernel by IOCTL, this handle is not used for IRP Pending of message tracing. More...
 

Detailed Description

The hyperdbg command interpreter and driver connector.

Author
Sina Karvandi (sina@.nosp@m.raya.nosp@m.nfam..nosp@m.com)
Alee Amini (aleea.nosp@m.mini.nosp@m.z@gma.nosp@m.il.c.nosp@m.om)
Version
0.1
Date
2020-04-11
Copyright
This project is released under the GNU Public License v3.

Function Documentation

◆ CommandAttach()

VOID CommandAttach ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

.attach command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
278 {
279  UINT64 TargetPid = 0;
280  UINT64 TargetTid = 0;
281  BOOLEAN NextIsPid = FALSE;
282  BOOLEAN NextIsTid = FALSE;
283 
284  if (SplittedCommand.size() >= 6)
285  {
286  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.attach'\n\n");
287  CommandAttachHelp();
288  return;
289  }
290 
291  for (auto item : SplittedCommand)
292  {
293  //
294  // Find out whether the user enters pid or not
295  //
296  if (NextIsPid)
297  {
298  NextIsPid = FALSE;
299 
300  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(item, &TargetPid))
301  {
302  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for process id\n\n");
303  CommandAttachHelp();
304  return;
305  }
306  }
307  else if (NextIsTid)
308  {
309  NextIsTid = FALSE;
310 
311  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(item, &TargetTid))
312  {
313  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for thread id\n\n");
314  CommandAttachHelp();
315  return;
316  }
317  }
318  else if (!item.compare("pid"))
319  {
320  //
321  // next item is a pid for the process
322  //
323  NextIsPid = TRUE;
324  }
325  else if (!item.compare("tid"))
326  {
327  //
328  // next item is a tid for the thread
329  //
330  NextIsTid = TRUE;
331  }
332  }
333 
334  //
335  // Check if the process id is empty or not
336  //
337  if (TargetPid == 0)
338  {
339  ShowMessages("please specify a hex value for process id\n\n");
340  CommandAttachHelp();
341  return;
342  }
343 
344  //
345  // Check if the thread id is specified or not, if not then
346  // we should just show the thread of the target process
347  //
348  if (TargetTid == 0)
349  {
350  ListProcessThreads(TargetPid);
351  return;
352  }
353  else
354  {
355  //
356  // Check if the process id and thread id is correct or not
357  //
358  if (!CheckThreadByProcessId(TargetPid, TargetTid))
359  {
360  ShowMessages("err, the thread or the process not found or the thread not "
361  "belongs to the process\n");
362  return;
363  }
364  }
365 
366  //
367  // Perform attach to target process
368  //
369  AttachToProcess(TargetPid, TargetTid);
370 }
CommandAttachHelp
VOID CommandAttachHelp()
help of .attach command
Definition: attach.cpp:183
ListProcessThreads
BOOL ListProcessThreads(DWORD dwOwnerPID)
List of threads by owner process id.
Definition: attach.cpp:63
CheckThreadByProcessId
BOOLEAN CheckThreadByProcessId(DWORD Pid, DWORD Tid)
Check if a thread belongs to special process.
Definition: attach.cpp:123
AttachToProcess
VOID AttachToProcess(UINT32 TargetPid, UINT32 TargetTid)
Attach to target process.
Definition: attach.cpp:205
ShowMessages
VOID ShowMessages(const char *Fmt,...)
Show messages received from kernel driver.
Definition: hprdbgctrl.cpp:52
ConvertStringToUInt64
BOOLEAN ConvertStringToUInt64(string TextToConvert, PUINT64 Result)
check and convert string to a 64 bit unsigned integer and also check for special notations like 0x et...
Definition: common.cpp:235

◆ CommandBc()

VOID CommandBc ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of bc command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
42 {
43  UINT64 BreakpointId;
44  DEBUGGEE_BP_LIST_OR_MODIFY_PACKET Request = {0};
45 
46  //
47  // Validate the commands
48  //
49  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
50  {
51  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'bc'\n\n");
52  CommandBcHelp();
53  return;
54  }
55 
56  //
57  // Get the breakpoint id
58  //
59  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(SplittedCommand.at(1), &BreakpointId))
60  {
61  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for breakpoint id\n\n");
62  CommandBcHelp();
63 
64  return;
65  }
66 
67  //
68  // Check if the remote serial debuggee is paused or not (connected or not)
69  //
70  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
71  {
72  //
73  // Perform clearing breakpoint
74  //
75  Request.Request = DEBUGGEE_BREAKPOINT_MODIFICATION_REQUEST_CLEAR;
76 
77  //
78  // Set breakpoint id
79  //
80  Request.BreakpointId = BreakpointId;
81 
82  //
83  // Send the request
84  //
85  KdSendListOrModifyPacketToDebuggee(&Request);
86  }
87  else
88  {
89  ShowMessages("err, clearing breakpoints is only valid if you connected to "
90  "a debuggee in debugger-mode\n");
91  }
92 }
CommandBcHelp
VOID CommandBcHelp()
help of bc command
Definition: bc.cpp:25
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)
Definition: globals.h:171
KdSendListOrModifyPacketToDebuggee
BOOLEAN KdSendListOrModifyPacketToDebuggee(PDEBUGGEE_BP_LIST_OR_MODIFY_PACKET ListOrModifyPacket)
Sends a breakpoint list or modification packet to the debuggee.
Definition: kd.cpp:660

◆ CommandBd()

VOID CommandBd ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,

)

handler of bd command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
42 {
43  UINT64 BreakpointId;
44  DEBUGGEE_BP_LIST_OR_MODIFY_PACKET Request = {0};
45 
46  //
47  // Validate the commands
48  //
49  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
50  {
51  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'bd'\n\n");
52  CommandBdHelp();
53  return;
54  }
55 
56  //
57  // Get the breakpoint id
58  //
59  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(SplittedCommand.at(1), &BreakpointId))
60  {
61  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for breakpoint id\n\n");
62  CommandBdHelp();
63 
64  return;
65  }
66 
67  //
68  // Check if the remote serial debuggee is paused or not (connected or not)
69  //
70  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
71  {
72  //
73  // Perform disabling breakpoint
74  //
75  Request.Request = DEBUGGEE_BREAKPOINT_MODIFICATION_REQUEST_DISABLE;
76 
77  //
78  // Set breakpoint id
79  //
80  Request.BreakpointId = BreakpointId;
81 
82  //
83  // Send the request
84  //
85  KdSendListOrModifyPacketToDebuggee(&Request);
86  }
87  else
88  {
89  ShowMessages("err, disabling breakpoints is only valid if you connected to "
90  "a debuggee in debugger-mode\n");
91  }
92 }

)

Returns
VOID
42 {
43  UINT64 BreakpointId;
44  DEBUGGEE_BP_LIST_OR_MODIFY_PACKET Request = {0};
45 
46  //
47  // Validate the commands
48  //
49  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
50  {
51  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'be'\n\n");
52  CommandBeHelp();
53  return;
54  }
55 
56  //
57  // Get the breakpoint id
58  //
59  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(SplittedCommand.at(1), &BreakpointId))
60  {
61  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for breakpoint id\n\n");
62  CommandBeHelp();
63 
64  return;
65  }
66 
67  //
68  // Check if the remote serial debuggee is paused or not (connected or not)
69  //
70  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
71  {
72  //
73  // Perform enabling breakpoint
74  //
75  Request.Request = DEBUGGEE_BREAKPOINT_MODIFICATION_REQUEST_ENABLE;
76 
77  //
78  // Set breakpoint id
79  //
80  Request.BreakpointId = BreakpointId;
81 
82  //
83  // Send the request
84  //
85  KdSendListOrModifyPacketToDebuggee(&Request);
86  }
87  else

89  ShowMessages("err, enabling breakpoints is only valid if you connected to "
90  "a debuggee in debugger-mode\n");
91  }
92 }

◆ CommandBl()

VOID CommandBl ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of bl command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
40 {
41  DEBUGGEE_BP_LIST_OR_MODIFY_PACKET Request = {0};
42 
43  //
44  // Validate the commands
45  //
46  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1)
47  {
48  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'bl'\n\n");
49  CommandBlHelp();
50  return;
51  }
52 
53  //
54  // Check if the remote serial debuggee is paused or not (connected or not)
55  //
56  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
57  {
58  //
59  // Perform listing breakpoint
60  //
61  Request.Request = DEBUGGEE_BREAKPOINT_MODIFICATION_REQUEST_LIST_BREAKPOINTS;
62 
63  //
64  // Send the request
65  //
66  KdSendListOrModifyPacketToDebuggee(&Request);
67  ShowMessages("\n");
68  }
69  else
70  {
71  ShowMessages("err, listing breakpoints is only valid if you connected to "
72  "a debuggee in debugger-mode\n");
73  }
74 }

◆ CommandBp()

VOID CommandBp ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

bp command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
50 {
51  BOOL IsNextCoreId = FALSE;
52  BOOL IsNextPid = FALSE;
53  BOOL IsNextTid = FALSE;
54 
55  BOOLEAN SetCoreId = FALSE;
56  BOOLEAN SetPid = FALSE;
57  BOOLEAN SetTid = FALSE;
58  BOOLEAN SetAddress = FALSE;
59 
60  UINT32 Tid = DEBUGGEE_BP_APPLY_TO_ALL_THREADS;
61  UINT32 Pid = DEBUGGEE_BP_APPLY_TO_ALL_PROCESSES;
62  UINT32 CoreNumer = DEBUGGEE_BP_APPLY_TO_ALL_CORES;
63  UINT64 Address = NULL;
64  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
65  UINT32 IndexInCommandCaseSensitive = 0;
66 
67  DEBUGGEE_BP_PACKET BpPacket = {0};
68 
69  if (SplittedCommand.size() >= 9)
70  {
71  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'bp'\n\n");
72  CommandBpHelp();
73  return;
74  }
75 
76  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
77  {
78  IndexInCommandCaseSensitive++;
79 
80  //
81  // Ignore the first argument as it's the command string itself (bp)
82  //
83  if (!Section.compare(SplittedCommand.at(0)))
84  {
85  continue;
86  }
87 
88  if (IsNextCoreId)
89  {
90  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(Section, &CoreNumer))
91  {
92  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for core id\n\n");
93  CommandBpHelp();
94  return;
95  }
96  IsNextCoreId = FALSE;
97  continue;
98  }
99  if (IsNextPid)
100  {
101  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(Section, &Pid))
102  {
103  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for process id\n\n");
104  CommandBpHelp();
105  return;
106  }
107  IsNextPid = FALSE;
108  continue;
109  }
110 
111  if (IsNextTid)
112  {
113  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(Section, &Tid))
114  {
115  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for thread id\n\n");
116  CommandBpHelp();
117  return;
118  }
119  IsNextTid = FALSE;
120  continue;
121  }
122 
123  if (!Section.compare("pid"))
124  {
125  IsNextPid = TRUE;
126  continue;
127  }
128  if (!Section.compare("tid"))
129  {
130  IsNextTid = TRUE;
131  continue;
132  }
133  if (!Section.compare("core"))
134  {
135  IsNextCoreId = TRUE;
136  continue;
137  }
138 
139  if (!SetAddress)
140  {
141  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1), &Address))
142  {
143  //
144  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
145  //
146  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
147  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1).c_str());
148  CommandBpHelp();
149  return;
150  }
151  else
152  {
153  //
154  // Means that address is received
155  //
156  SetAddress = TRUE;
157  continue;
158  }
159  }
160  }
161 
162  //
163  // Check if address is set or not
164  //
165  if (!SetAddress)
166  {
167  ShowMessages(
168  "please specify a correct hex value as the breakpoint address\n\n");
169  CommandBpHelp();
170  return;
171  }
172  if (IsNextPid)
173  {
174  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for process id\n\n");
175  CommandBpHelp();
176  return;
177  }
178  if (IsNextCoreId)
179  {
180  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for core\n\n");
181  CommandBpHelp();
182  return;
183  }
184  if (IsNextTid)
185  {
186  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for thread id\n\n");
187  CommandBpHelp();
188  return;
189  }
190 
191  if (!g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
192  {
193  ShowMessages("err, setting breakpoints is not possible when you're not "
194  "connected to a debuggee\n");
195  return;
196  }
197 
198  //
199  // Set the details for the remote packet
200  //
201  BpPacket.Address = Address;
202  BpPacket.Core = CoreNumer;
203  BpPacket.Pid = Pid;
204  BpPacket.Tid = Tid;
205 
206  //
207  // Send the bp packet
208  //
209  KdSendBpPacketToDebuggee(&BpPacket);
210 }
NULL
#define NULL
Definition: GdbStub.h:33
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)
Definition: globals.h:171
CommandBpHelp
VOID CommandBpHelp()
help of bp command
Definition: bp.cpp:25
Split
const vector< string > Split(const string &s, const char &c)
general split command
Definition: common.cpp:111
ConvertStringToUInt32

◆ CommandConnect()

VOID CommandConnect ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

.connect command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
55 {
56  string ip;
57  string port;
58 
59  if (g_IsConnectedToHyperDbgLocally || g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebuggee ||
60  g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
61  {
62  ShowMessages("you're connected to a debugger, please use '.disconnect' "
63  "command\n");
64  return;
65  }
66 
67  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee ||
68  g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
69  {
70  ShowMessages("you're connected to a an instance of HyperDbg, please use "
71  "'.debug close' command\n");
72  return;
73  }
74 
75  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
76  {
77  //
78  // Means that user entered just a connect so we have to
79  // ask to connect to what ?
80  //
81  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.connect'\n\n");
82  CommandConnectHelp();
83  return;
84  }
85  else if (SplittedCommand.at(1) == "local" && SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
86  {
87  //
88  // connect to local debugger
89  //
90  ShowMessages("local debugging (vmi-mode)\n");
91  g_IsConnectedToHyperDbgLocally = TRUE;
92  return;
93  }
94  else if (SplittedCommand.size() == 3 || SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
95  {
96  ip = SplittedCommand.at(1);
97 
98  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 3)
99  {
100  port = SplittedCommand.at(2);
101  }
102 
103  //
104  // means that probably wants to connect to a remote
105  // system, let's first check the if the parameters are
106  // valid
107  //
108  if (!ValidateIP(ip))
109  {
110  ShowMessages("incorrect ip address\n");
111  return;
112  }
113 
114  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 3)
115  {
116  if (!IsNumber(port) || stoi(port) > 65535 || stoi(port) < 0)
117  {
118  ShowMessages("incorrect port\n");
119  return;
120  }
121 
122  //
123  // connect to remote debugger
124  //
125  g_ServerIp = ip;
126  g_ServerPort = port;
127  RemoteConnectionConnect(ip.c_str(), port.c_str());
128  }
129  else
130  {
131  //
132  // connect to remote debugger (default port)
133  //
134  g_ServerIp = ip;
135  g_ServerPort = DEFAULT_PORT;
136  RemoteConnectionConnect(ip.c_str(), DEFAULT_PORT);
137  }
138  }
139  else
140  {
141  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.connect'\n\n");
142  CommandConnectHelp();
143  return;
144  }
145 }
IsNumber
BOOLEAN IsNumber(const string &str)
check if given string is a numeric string or not
Definition: common.cpp:139

~ command handler

43 {
44  UINT32 TargetCore = 0;
45 
46  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1 && SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
47  {
48  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '~'\n\n");
49  CommandCoreHelp();
50  return;
51  }
52 
53  //
54  // Check if it's connected to a remote debuggee or not
55  //
56  if (!g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
57  {
58  ShowMessages("err, you're not connected to any debuggee\n");
59  return;
60  }
61 
62  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
63  {
64  ShowMessages("current processor : 0x%x\n", g_CurrentRemoteCore);
65  }
66  else if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
67  {
68  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(SplittedCommand.at(1), &TargetCore))
69  {
70  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for the core that you "
71  "want to operate on it\n\n");
72  CommandCoreHelp();
73  return;
74  }
75 
76  //
77  // Send the changing core packet
78  //
79  KdSendSwitchCorePacketToDebuggee(TargetCore);

◆ CommandCpuid()

VOID CommandCpuid ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!cpuid command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
43 {
44  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
45  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
47  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
48  UINT32 EventLength;
49  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
50  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
51  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
52  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
53 
54  //
55  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
56  //
57  //
58  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
59  &SplittedCommand,
60  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
61  CPUID_INSTRUCTION_EXECUTION,
62  &Event,
63  &EventLength,
64  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
65  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
66  &ActionCustomCode,
67  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
68  &ActionScript,
69  &ActionScriptLength))
70  {
71  CommandCpuidHelp();
72  return;
73  }
74 
75  //
76  // Check for size
77  //
78  if (SplittedCommand.size() > 1)
79  {
80  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!cpuid'\n");
81  CommandCpuidHelp();
82  return;
83  }
84 
85  //
86  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
87  //
88  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
89  {
90  //
91  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
92  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
93  // already freed the Event and string buffers
94  //
95  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
96  {
97  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
98  }
99  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
100  {
101  free(ActionCustomCode);
102  }
103  if (ActionScript != NULL)
104  {
105  free(ActionScript);
106  }
107  return;
108  }
109 
110  //
111  // Add the event to the kernel
112  //
113  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
114  {
115  //
116  // There was an error
117  //
118  return;
119  }
120 }
CommandCpuidHelp
VOID CommandCpuidHelp()
help of !cpuid command
Definition: cpuid.cpp:20

Register the action to the event.

◆ CommandDebug()

VOID CommandDebug ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

.debug command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
110 {
111  UINT32 Baudrate;
112  UINT32 Port;
113 
114  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2 && !SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("close"))
115  {
116  if (!g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee &&
117  !g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
118  {
119  ShowMessages(
120  "err, debugger is not attached to any instance of debuggee\n");
121  }
122  else
123  {
124  KdCloseConnection();
125  }
126  return;
127  }
128  else if (SplittedCommand.size() <= 3)
129  {
130  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.debug'\n\n");
131  CommandDebugHelp();
132  return;
133  }
134 
135  //
136  // Check the main command
137  //
138  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("remote"))
139  {
140  //
141  // in the case of 'remote'
142  //
143 
144  if (!SplittedCommand.at(2).compare("serial"))
145  {
146  //
147  // Connect to a remote serial device
148  //
149  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 5)
150  {
151  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.debug'\n\n");
152  CommandDebugHelp();
153  return;
154  }
155 
156  //
157  // Set baudrate
158  //
159  if (!IsNumber(SplittedCommand.at(3)))
160  {
161  //
162  // Unkonwn parameter
163  //
164  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n",
165  SplittedCommand.at(3).c_str());
166  CommandDebugHelp();
167  return;
168  }
169 
170  Baudrate = stoi(SplittedCommand.at(3));
171 
172  //
173  // Check if baudrate is valid or not
174  //
175  if (!CommandDebugCheckBaudrate(Baudrate))
176  {
177  //
178  // Baud-rate is invalid
179  //
180  ShowMessages("err, baud rate is invalid\n\n");
181  CommandDebugHelp();
182  return;
183  }
184 
185  //
186  // check if com port address is valid or not
187  //
188  if (!CommandDebugCheckComPort(SplittedCommand.at(4), &Port))
189  {
190  //
191  // com port is invalid
192  //
193  ShowMessages("err, COM port is invalid\n\n");
194  CommandDebugHelp();
195  return;
196  }
197 
198  //
199  // Everything is okay, connect to the remote machine to send (debugger)
200  //
201  KdPrepareAndConnectDebugPort(SplittedCommand.at(4).c_str(), Baudrate, Port, FALSE, FALSE);
202  }
203  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(2).compare("namedpipe"))
204  {
205  //
206  // Connect to a remote namedpipe
207  //
208  string Delimiter = "namedpipe";
209  string Token = Command.substr(
210  Command.find(Delimiter) + Delimiter.size() + 1,
211  Command.size());
212 
213  //
214  // Connect to a namedpipe (it's probably a Virtual Machine debugging)
215  //
216  KdPrepareAndConnectDebugPort(Token.c_str(), NULL, NULL, FALSE, TRUE);
217  }
218  else
219  {
220  //
221  // Unkonwn parameter
222  //
223  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", SplittedCommand.at(2).c_str());
224  CommandDebugHelp();
225  return;
226  }
227  }
228  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("prepare"))
229  {
230  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 5)
231  {
232  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.debug'\n\n");
233  CommandDebugHelp();
234  return;
235  }
236 
237  //
238  // in the case of 'prepare'
239  // currently we only support serial
240  //
241  if (!SplittedCommand.at(2).compare("serial"))
242  {
243  //
244  // Set baudrate
245  //
246  if (!IsNumber(SplittedCommand.at(3)))
247  {
248  //
249  // Unkonwn parameter
250  //
251  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n",
252  SplittedCommand.at(3).c_str());
253  CommandDebugHelp();
254  return;
255  }
256 
257  Baudrate = stoi(SplittedCommand.at(3));
258 
259  //
260  // Check if baudrate is valid or not
261  //
262  if (!CommandDebugCheckBaudrate(Baudrate))
263  {
264  //
265  // Baud-rate is invalid
266  //
267  ShowMessages("err, baud rate is invalid\n\n");
268  CommandDebugHelp();
269  return;
270  }
271 
272  //
273  // check if com port address is valid or not
274  //
275  if (!CommandDebugCheckComPort(SplittedCommand.at(4), &Port))
276  {
277  //
278  // com port is invalid
279  //
280  ShowMessages("err, COM port is invalid\n\n");
281  CommandDebugHelp();
282  return;
283  }
284 
285  //
286  // Everything is okay, prepare to send (debuggee)
287  //
288  KdPrepareAndConnectDebugPort(SplittedCommand.at(4).c_str(), Baudrate, Port, TRUE, FALSE);
289  }
290  else
291  {
292  ShowMessages("invalid parameter '%s'\n\n", SplittedCommand.at(2));
293  CommandDebugHelp();
294  return;
295  }
296  }
297  else
298  {
299  ShowMessages("invalid parameter '%s'\n\n", SplittedCommand.at(1));
300  CommandDebugHelp();
301  return;
302  }
303 }
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debugger (A remote host)
Definition: globals.h:178
CommandDebugCheckBaudrate

help of .debug command

◆ CommandDisconnect()

VOID CommandDisconnect ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

.disconnect command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
44 {
45  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1)
46  {
47  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.disconnect'\n\n");
48  CommandDisconnectHelp();
49  return;
50  }
51 
52  if (!g_IsConnectedToHyperDbgLocally && !g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
53  {
54  ShowMessages("you're not connected to any instance of HyperDbg, did you "
55  "use '.connect'? \n");
56  return;
57  }
58 
59  //
60  // Check if it's local debugger and the driver is still
61  // loading (not unloaded)
62  //
63  if (g_IsConnectedToHyperDbgLocally && g_DeviceHandle)
64  {
65  ShowMessages("you cannot disconnect in local debugging while the "
66  "driver is still loaded. please use 'unload' command before "
67  "disconnecting from the current instance of debugger\n");
68  return;
69  }
70 
71  //
72  // Disconnect the session
73  //
74  g_IsConnectedToHyperDbgLocally = FALSE;
75 
76  //
77  // This computer is connected to a remote system
78  //
79  if (g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
80  {
81  //
82  // We should kill the thread that was listening for the
83  // remote commands and close the connection
84  //
85  TerminateThread(g_RemoteDebuggeeListeningThread, 0);
86  CloseHandle(g_RemoteDebuggeeListeningThread);
87  CloseHandle(g_EndOfMessageReceivedEvent);
88  g_EndOfMessageReceivedEvent = NULL;
89 
90  RemoteConnectionCloseTheConnectionWithDebuggee();
91 
92  g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebuggee = FALSE;
93  }
94 
95  ShowMessages("disconnected successfully\n");
96 }

Holds the global handle of device which is used to send the request to the kernel by IOCTL,...

VOID CommandDr ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,

)

42 {
43  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
44  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
45  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
47  UINT32 EventLength;
48  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
49  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
50  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
51  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
52 
53  //
54  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
55  //
56  //
57  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
58  &SplittedCommand,
59  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
60  DEBUG_REGISTERS_ACCESSED,
61  &Event,
62  &EventLength,
63  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
64  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
65  &ActionCustomCode,
66  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
67  &ActionScript,
68  &ActionScriptLength))
69  {
70  CommandDrHelp();
71  return;
72  }
73 
74  //
75  // Check for size
76  //
77  if (SplittedCommand.size() > 1)
78  {
79  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!dr'\n");
80  CommandDrHelp();
81  return;
82  }
83 
84  //
85  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
86  //
87  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
88  {
89  //
90  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
91  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
92  // already freed the Event and string buffers
93  //
94  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
95  {
96  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
97  }
98  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
99  {
100  free(ActionCustomCode);
101  }
102  if (ActionScript != NULL)
103  {
104  free(ActionScript);
105  }
106  return;
107  }
108 
109  //
110  // Add the event to the kernel
111  //
112  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
113  {
114  //
115  // There was an error
116  //
117  return;
118  }
119 }

◆ CommandEditMemory()

VOID CommandEditMemory ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,

)

53 {
54  BOOL Status;
55  UINT64 Address;

74  return;
75  }
76 
77  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
78  {
79  IndexInCommandCaseSensitive++;
80 
81  if (!Section.compare(SplittedCommand.at(0)))
82  {
83  if (!Section.compare("!eb"))
84  {
85  EditMemoryRequest.MemoryType = EDIT_PHYSICAL_MEMORY;
86  EditMemoryRequest.ByteSize = EDIT_BYTE;
87  }
88  else if (!Section.compare("!ed"))
89  {
90  EditMemoryRequest.MemoryType = EDIT_PHYSICAL_MEMORY;
91  EditMemoryRequest.ByteSize = EDIT_DWORD;
92  }
93  else if (!Section.compare("!eq"))
94  {
95  EditMemoryRequest.MemoryType = EDIT_PHYSICAL_MEMORY;
96  EditMemoryRequest.ByteSize = EDIT_QWORD;
97  }
98  else if (!Section.compare("eb"))
99  {
100  EditMemoryRequest.MemoryType = EDIT_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
101  EditMemoryRequest.ByteSize = EDIT_BYTE;
102  }
103  else if (!Section.compare("ed"))
104  {
105  EditMemoryRequest.MemoryType = EDIT_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
106  EditMemoryRequest.ByteSize = EDIT_DWORD;
107  }
108  else if (!Section.compare("eq"))
109  {
110  EditMemoryRequest.MemoryType = EDIT_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
111  EditMemoryRequest.ByteSize = EDIT_QWORD;
112  }
113  else
114  {
115  //
116  // What's this? :(
117  //
118  ShowMessages("unknown error happened !\n\n");
119  CommandEditMemoryHelp();
120  return;
121  }
122 
123  continue;
124  }
125  if (NextIsProcId)
126  {
127  //
128  // It's a process id
129  //
130  NextIsProcId = FALSE;
131 
132  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(Section, &ProcId))
133  {
134  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex prcoess id\n\n");
135  CommandEditMemoryHelp();
136  return;
137  }
138  else
139  {
140  //
141  // Means that the proc id is set, next we should read value
142  //
143  continue;
144  }
145  }
146 
147  //
148  // Check if it's a process id or not
149  //
150  if (!SetProcId && !Section.compare("pid"))
151  {
152  NextIsProcId = TRUE;
153  continue;
154  }
155 
156  if (!SetAddress)
157  {
158  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1),
159  &Address))
160  {
161  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
162  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1).c_str());
163  CommandEditMemoryHelp();
164  return;
165  }
166  else
167  {
168  //
169  // Means that the address is set, next we should read value
170  //
171  SetAddress = TRUE;
172  continue;
173  }
174  }
175 
176  if (SetAddress)
177  {
178  //
179  // Remove the hex notations
180  //
181  if (Section.rfind("0x", 0) == 0 || Section.rfind("0X", 0) == 0 ||
182  Section.rfind("\\x", 0) == 0 || Section.rfind("\\X", 0) == 0)
183  {
184  Section = Section.erase(0, 2);
185  }
186  else if (Section.rfind("x", 0) == 0 || Section.rfind("X", 0) == 0)
187  {
188  Section = Section.erase(0, 1);
189  }
190  Section.erase(remove(Section.begin(), Section.end(), '`'), Section.end());
191 
192  //
193  // Check if the value is valid based on byte counts
194  //
195  if (EditMemoryRequest.ByteSize == EDIT_BYTE && Section.size() >= 3)
196  {
197  ShowMessages("please specify a byte (hex) value for 'eb' or '!eb'\n\n");
198  return;
199  }
200  if (EditMemoryRequest.ByteSize == EDIT_DWORD && Section.size() >= 9)
201  {
202  ShowMessages(
203  "please specify a dword (hex) value for 'ed' or '!ed'\n\n");
204  return;
205  }
206  if (EditMemoryRequest.ByteSize == EDIT_QWORD && Section.size() >= 17)
207  {
208  ShowMessages(
209  "please specify a qword (hex) value for 'eq' or '!eq'\n\n");
210  return;
211  }
212 
213  //
214  // Qword is checked by the following function, no need to double
215  // check it above.
216  //
217 
218  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &Value))
219  {
220  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value to change the memory "
221  "content\n\n");
222  CommandEditMemoryHelp();
223  return;
224  }
225  else
226  {
227  //
228  // Add it to the list
229  //
230 
231  ValuesToEdit.push_back(Value);
232 
233  //
234  // Keep track of values to modify
235  //
236  CountOfValues++;
237 
238  if (!SetValue)
239  {
240  //
241  // At least on value is there
242  //
243  SetValue = TRUE;
244  }
245  continue;
246  }
247  }
248  }
249 
250  //
251  // Check to prevent using process id in e* commands
252  //
253  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee && ProcId != 0)
254  {
255  ShowMessages("err, you cannot specify 'pid' in the debugger mode\n\n");
256  return;
257  }
258 
259  if (ProcId == 0)
260  {
261  ProcId = GetCurrentProcessId();
262  }
263 
264  //
265  // Fill the structure
266  //
267  EditMemoryRequest.ProcessId = ProcId;
268  EditMemoryRequest.Address = Address;
269  EditMemoryRequest.CountOf64Chunks = CountOfValues;
270 
271  //
272  // Check if address and value are set or not
273  //
274  if (!SetAddress)
275  {
276  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex address\n\n");
277  CommandEditMemoryHelp();
278  return;
279  }
280  if (!SetValue)
281  {
282  ShowMessages(
283  "please specify a correct hex value as the content to edit\n\n");
284  CommandEditMemoryHelp();
285  return;
286  }
287  if (NextIsProcId)
288  {
289  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value as the process id\n\n");
290  CommandEditMemoryHelp();
291  return;
292  }
293 
294  //
295  // Now it's time to put everything together in one structure
296  //
297  FinalSize = (CountOfValues * sizeof(UINT64)) + SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_EDIT_MEMORY;
298 
299  //
300  // Set the size
301  //
302  EditMemoryRequest.FinalStructureSize = FinalSize;
303 
304  //
305  // Allocate structure + buffer
306  //
307  FinalBuffer = (UINT64 *)malloc(FinalSize);
308 
309  if (!FinalBuffer)
310  {
311  ShowMessages("unable to allocate memory\n\n");
312  return;
313  }
314 
315  //
316  // Zero the buffer
317  //
318  ZeroMemory(FinalBuffer, FinalSize);
319 
320  //
321  // Copy the structure on top of the allocated buffer
322  //
323  memcpy(FinalBuffer, &EditMemoryRequest, SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_EDIT_MEMORY);
324 
325  //
326  // Put the values in 64 bit structures
327  //
328  std::copy(ValuesToEdit.begin(), ValuesToEdit.end(), (UINT64 *)((UINT64)FinalBuffer + SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_EDIT_MEMORY));
329 
330  //
331  // send the request
332  //
333  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
334  {
335  KdSendEditMemoryPacketToDebuggee((DEBUGGER_EDIT_MEMORY *)FinalBuffer, FinalSize);
336  return;
337  }
338  else if (!g_DeviceHandle)
339  {
340  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
341  "use 'load' command?\n");
342  return;
343  }
344 
345  Status = DeviceIoControl(
346  g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
347  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_EDIT_MEMORY, // IO Control code
348  FinalBuffer, // Input Buffer to driver.
349  FinalSize, // Input buffer length
350  &EditMemoryRequest, // Output Buffer from driver.
351  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_EDIT_MEMORY, // Length of output buffer in bytes.
352  NULL, // Bytes placed in buffer.
353  NULL // synchronous call
354  );
355 
356  if (!Status)
357  {
358  free(FinalBuffer);
359  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code 0x%x\n", GetLastError());
360  return;
361  }
362 
363  if (EditMemoryRequest.Result == DEBUGEER_OPERATION_WAS_SUCCESSFULL)
364  {
365  //
366  // Was successful, nothing to do
367  //
368  }
369  else if (
370  EditMemoryRequest.Result ==
371  DEBUGGER_ERROR_EDIT_MEMORY_STATUS_INVALID_ADDRESS_BASED_ON_CURRENT_PROCESS)
372  {
373  ShowMessages("err, the address is invalid in system process layout\n");
374  }
375  else if (
376  EditMemoryRequest.Result ==
377  DEBUGGER_ERROR_EDIT_MEMORY_STATUS_INVALID_ADDRESS_BASED_ON_OTHER_PROCESS)
378  {
379  ShowMessages("err, the address is invalid based on your specific process id\n");
380  }
381  else if (EditMemoryRequest.Result ==
382  DEBUGGER_ERROR_EDIT_MEMORY_STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER)
383  {
384  ShowMessages("invalid parameter\n");
385  }
386  else
387  {
388  ShowErrorMessage(EditMemoryRequest.Result);
389  }
390 
391  //
392  // Free the malloc buffer
393  //
394  free(FinalBuffer);
395 }
ShowErrorMessage
BOOLEAN ShowErrorMessage(UINT32 Error)
shows the error message
Definition: debugger.cpp:36
CommandEditMemoryHelp
VOID CommandEditMemoryHelp()
help of !e* and e* commands
Definition: e.cpp:25
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)
Definition: globals.h:171
KdSendEditMemoryPacketToDebuggee
BOOLEAN KdSendEditMemoryPacketToDebuggee(PDEBUGGER_EDIT_MEMORY EditMem, UINT32 Size)
Send an Edit memory packet to the debuggee.
Definition: kd.cpp:397

◆ CommandEptHook()

VOID CommandEptHook ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!epthook command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
44 {
45  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
47  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
48  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
49  UINT32 EventLength;
50  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
51  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
52  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
53  BOOLEAN GetAddress = FALSE;
54  UINT64 OptionalParam1 = 0; // Set the target address
55  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
56  UINT32 IndexInCommandCaseSensitive = 0;
57 
58  if (SplittedCommand.size() < 2)
59  {
60  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!epthook'\n");
61  CommandEptHookHelp();
62  return;
63  }
64 
65  //
66  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
67  //
68  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
69  &SplittedCommand,
70  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
71  HIDDEN_HOOK_EXEC_CC,
72  &Event,
73  &EventLength,
74  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
75  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
76  &ActionCustomCode,
77  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
78  &ActionScript,
79  &ActionScriptLength))
80  {
81  CommandEptHookHelp();
82  return;
83  }
84 
85  //
86  // Interpret command specific details (if any)
87  //
88  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
89  {
90  IndexInCommandCaseSensitive++;
91 
92  if (!Section.compare("!epthook"))
93  {
94  continue;
95  }
96  else if (!GetAddress)
97  {
98  //
99  // It's probably address
100  //
101  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(
102  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1),
103  &OptionalParam1))
104  {
105  //
106  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
107  //
108  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
109  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1).c_str());
110  CommandEptHookHelp();
111  return;
112  }
113  else
114  {
115  GetAddress = TRUE;
116  }
117  }
118  else
119  {
120  //
121  // Unkonwn parameter
122  //
123  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
124  CommandEptHookHelp();
125  return;
126  }
127  }
128  if (OptionalParam1 == 0)
129  {
130  ShowMessages(
131  "Please choose an address to put the hidden breakpoint on it\n");
132  return;
133  }
134 
135  //
136  // Set the optional parameters
137  //
138  Event->OptionalParam1 = OptionalParam1;
139 
140  //
141  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
142  //
143  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
144  {
145  //
146  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
147  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
148  // already freed the Event and string buffers
149  //
150  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
151  {
152  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
153  }
154  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
155  {
156  free(ActionCustomCode);
157  }
158  if (ActionScript != NULL)
159  {
160  free(ActionScript);
161  }
162  return;
163  }
164 
165  //
166  // Add the event to the kernel
167  //
168  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
169  {
170  //
171  // There was an error
172  //
173  return;
174  }
175 }
CommandEptHookHelp
VOID CommandEptHookHelp()
help of !epthook command
Definition: epthook.cpp:20

)

Command

VOID
44 {
45  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
47  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
48  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
49  UINT32 EventLength;
50  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
51  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
52  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
53  BOOLEAN GetAddress = FALSE;
54  UINT64 OptionalParam1 = 0; // Set the target address
55  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
56  UINT32 IndexInCommandCaseSensitive = 0;
57 
58  if (SplittedCommand.size() < 2)
59  {
60  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!epthook2'\n");
61  CommandEptHook2Help();
62  return;
63  }
64 
65  //
66  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
67  //
68  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
69  &SplittedCommand,
70  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
71  HIDDEN_HOOK_EXEC_DETOURS,
72  &Event,
73  &EventLength,
74  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
75  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
76  &ActionCustomCode,
77  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
78  &ActionScript,
79  &ActionScriptLength))
80  {
81  CommandEptHook2Help();
82  return;
83  }
84

86  // Interpret command specific details (if any)
87  //
88  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
89  {
90  IndexInCommandCaseSensitive++;
91 
92  if (!Section.compare("!epthook2"))
93  {
94  continue;
95  }
96  else if (!GetAddress)
97  {
98  //
99  // It's probably address
100  //
101  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(
102  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1),
103  &OptionalParam1))
104  {
105  //
106  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
107  //
108  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
109  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1).c_str());
110  CommandEptHook2Help();
111  return;
112  }
113  else
114  {
115  GetAddress = TRUE;
116  }
117  }
118  else
119  {
120  //
121  // Unkonwn parameter
122  //
123  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
124  CommandEptHook2Help();
125  return;
126  }
127  }
128  if (OptionalParam1 == 0)
129  {
130  ShowMessages("please choose an address to put the hook on it\n");
131  return;
132  }
133 
134  //
135  // Set the optional parameters
136  //
137  Event->OptionalParam1 = OptionalParam1;
138 
139  //
140  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
141  //
142  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
143  {
144  //
145  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
146  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
147  // already freed the Event and string buffers
148  //
149  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
150  {
151  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
152  }
153  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
154  {
155  free(ActionCustomCode);
156  }
157  if (ActionScript != NULL)
158  {
159  free(ActionScript);
160  }
161  return;
162  }
163 
164  //
165  // Add the event to the kernel
166  //
167  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
168  {
169  //
170  // There was an error
171  //
172  return;
173  }
174 }

◆ CommandEval()

VOID CommandEval ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of ? command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
44 {
45  PVOID CodeBuffer;
46  UINT64 BufferAddress;
47  UINT32 BufferLength;
48  UINT32 Pointer;
49 
50  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
51  {
52  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '?'\n\n");
53  CommandEvalHelp();
54  return;
55  }
56 
57  //
58  // Trim the command
59  //
60  Trim(Command);
61 
62  //
63  // Remove first command from it
64  //
65  Command.erase(0, SplittedCommand.at(0).size());
66 
67  //
68  // Trim it again
69  //
70  Trim(Command);
71 
72  //
73  // TODO: end of string must have a whitspace. fix it.
74  //
75  Command.append(" ");
76  // Expr = " x = 4 >> 1; ";
77 
78  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
79  {
80  //
81  // Send over serial
82  //
83 
84  //
85  // Run script engine handler
86  //
87  CodeBuffer = ScriptEngineParseWrapper((char *)Command.c_str());
88 
89  if (CodeBuffer == NULL)
90  {
91  //
92  // return to show that this item contains an script
93  //
94  return;
95  }
96 
97  //
98  // Print symbols (test)
99  //
100  // PrintSymbolBufferWrapper(CodeBuffer);
101 
102  //
103  // Set the buffer and length
104  //
105  BufferAddress = ScriptEngineWrapperGetHead(CodeBuffer);
106  BufferLength = ScriptEngineWrapperGetSize(CodeBuffer);
107  Pointer = ScriptEngineWrapperGetPointer(CodeBuffer);
108 
109  //
110  // Send it to the remote debuggee
111  //
112  KdSendScriptPacketToDebuggee(BufferAddress, BufferLength, Pointer, FALSE);
113 
114  //
115  // Remove the buffer of script engine interpreted code
116  //
117  ScriptEngineWrapperRemoveSymbolBuffer(CodeBuffer);
118  }
119  else
120  {
121  //
122  // It's a test
123  //
124  ShowMessages("this command should not be used while you're in VMI-Mode or not in debugger-mode, "
125  "the results that you see is a simulated result for TESTING script-engine "
126  "and is not based on the status of your system. You can use this command, "
127  "ONLY in debugger-mode\n\n");
128 
129  ShowMessages("test Expression : %s \n", Command.c_str());
130  ScriptEngineWrapperTestParser(Command);
131  }
132 }
Trim
void Trim(std::string &s)
trim from both ends and start of a string (in place)
Definition: common.cpp:472

VOID CommandEvalHelp()
help of ? command

UINT32 ScriptEngineWrapperGetSize(PVOID SymbolBuffer)
wrapper for getting size

test parser

KdSendScriptPacketToDebuggee
BOOLEAN KdSendScriptPacketToDebuggee(UINT64 BufferAddress, UINT32 BufferLength, UINT32 Pointer, BOOLEAN IsFormat)
Sends a script packet to the debuggee.

◆ CommandEvents()

VOID CommandEvents ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

events command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
56 {
57  DEBUGGER_MODIFY_EVENTS_TYPE RequestedAction;
58  UINT64 RequestedTag;
59 
60  //
61  // Validate the parameters (size)
62  //
63  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1 && SplittedCommand.size() != 3)
64  {
65  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '%s'\n\n", SplittedCommand.at(0));
66  CommandEventsHelp();
67  return;
68  }
69 
70  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
71  {
72  if (!g_EventTraceInitialized)
73  {
74  ShowMessages("no active/disabled events \n");
75  return;
76  }
77 
78  CommandEventsShowEvents();
79 
80  //
81  // No need to continue any further
82  //
83  return;
84  }
85 
86  //
87  // Validate second argument as it's not just a simple
88  // events without any parameter
89  //
90  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("e"))
91  {
92  RequestedAction = DEBUGGER_MODIFY_EVENTS_ENABLE;
93  }
94  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("d"))
95  {
96  RequestedAction = DEBUGGER_MODIFY_EVENTS_DISABLE;
97  }
98  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("c"))
99  {
100  RequestedAction = DEBUGGER_MODIFY_EVENTS_CLEAR;
101  }
102  else
103  {
104  //
105  // unknown second command
106  //
107  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '%s'\n\n", SplittedCommand.at(0));
108  CommandEventsHelp();
109  return;
110  }
111 
112  //
113  // Validate third argument as it's not just a simple
114  // events without any parameter
115  //
116  if (!SplittedCommand.at(2).compare("all"))
117  {
118  RequestedTag = DEBUGGER_MODIFY_EVENTS_APPLY_TO_ALL_TAG;
119  }
120  else if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(SplittedCommand.at(2), &RequestedTag))
121  {
122  ShowMessages(
123  "please specify a correct hex value for tag id (event number)\n\n");
124  CommandEventsHelp();
125  return;
126  }
127 
128  //
129  // Send the request to the kernel, we add it to a constant
130  // that's because we want start tags from that constant
131  //
132  if (RequestedTag != DEBUGGER_MODIFY_EVENTS_APPLY_TO_ALL_TAG)
133  {
134  RequestedTag = RequestedTag + DebuggerEventTagStartSeed;
135  }
136 
137  //
138  // Perform event related tasks
139  //
140  CommandEventsModifyAndQueryEvents(RequestedTag, RequestedAction);
141 }
CommandEventsShowEvents
VOID CommandEventsShowEvents()
print every active and disabled events
Definition: events.cpp:194
CommandEventsHelp
VOID CommandEventsHelp()
help of events command
Definition: events.cpp:31
g_EventTraceInitialized
BOOLEAN g_EventTraceInitialized
it shows whether the debugger started using events or not or in other words, is g_EventTrace initiali...
Definition: globals.h:297
CommandEventsModifyAndQueryEvents
BOOLEAN CommandEventsModifyAndQueryEvents(UINT64 Tag, DEBUGGER_MODIFY_EVENTS_TYPE TypeOfAction)
modify a special event (enable/disable/clear) and send the request directly to the kernel

◆ CommandException()

VOID CommandException ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!exception command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
48 {
49  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
50  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
51  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
52  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
53  UINT32 EventLength;
54  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
55  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
56  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
57  UINT64 SpecialTarget = DEBUGGER_EVENT_EXCEPTIONS_ALL_FIRST_32_ENTRIES;
58  BOOLEAN GetEntry = FALSE;
59  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
60 
61  //
62  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
63  //
64  //
65  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
66  &SplittedCommand,
67  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
68  EXCEPTION_OCCURRED,
69  &Event,
70  &EventLength,
71  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
72  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
73  &ActionCustomCode,
74  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
75  &ActionScript,
76  &ActionScriptLength))
77  {
78  CommandExceptionHelp();
79  return;
80  }
81 
82  //
83  // Interpret command specific details (if any)
84  //
85  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
86  {
87  if (!Section.compare("!exception"))
88  {
89  continue;
90  }
91  else if (!GetEntry)
92  {
93  //
94  // It's probably an index
95  //
96  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &SpecialTarget))
97  {
98  //
99  // Unkonwn parameter
100  //
101  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
102  CommandExceptionHelp();
103  return;
104  }
105  else
106  {
107  //
108  // Check if entry is valid or not (start from zero)
109  //
110  if (SpecialTarget >= 31)
111  {
112  //
113  // Entry is invalid (this command is designed for just first 32
114  // entries)
115  //
116  ShowMessages("the entry should be between 0x0 to 0x1f or first 32 "
117  "entries'\n\n");
118  CommandExceptionHelp();
119  return;
120  }
121  GetEntry = TRUE;
122  }
123  }
124  else
125  {
126  //
127  // Unkonwn parameter
128  //
129  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
130  CommandExceptionHelp();
131  return;
132  }
133  }
134 
135  //
136  // Set the target exception (if not specific then it means all exceptions)
137  //
138  Event->OptionalParam1 = SpecialTarget;
139 
140  //
141  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
142  //
143  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
144  {
145  //
146  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
147  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
148  // already freed the Event and string buffers
149  //
150  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
151  {
152  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
153  }
154  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
155  {
156  free(ActionCustomCode);
157  }
158  if (ActionScript != NULL)
159  {
160  free(ActionScript);
161  }
162  return;
163  }
164 
165  //
166  // Add the event to the kernel
167  //
168  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
169  {
170  //
171  // There was an error
172  //
173  return;
174  }
175 }
CommandExceptionHelp
VOID CommandExceptionHelp()
help of !exception command
Definition: exception.cpp:20

57  exit(0);

◆ CommandFormats()

VOID CommandFormats ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of .formats command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
100 {
101  PVOID CodeBuffer;
102  UINT64 BufferAddress;
103  UINT64 ConstantValue = 0;
104  UINT32 BufferLength;
105  UINT32 Pointer;
106 
107  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
108  {
109  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.formats'\n\n");
110  CommandFormatsHelp();
111  return;
112  }
113 
114  //
115  // Trim the command
116  //
117  Trim(Command);
118 
119  //
120  // Remove .formats from it
121  //
122  Command.erase(0, 8);
123 
124  //
125  // Trim it again
126  //
127  Trim(Command);
128 
129  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
130  {
131  //
132  // Send over serial
133  //
134  //
135  // Prepend and append 'print(' and ')'
136  //
137  Command.insert(0, "formats(");
138  Command.append(");");
139 
140  //
141  // TODO: end of string must have a whitspace. fix it.
142  //
143  Command.append(" ");
144  // Expr = " x = 4 >> 1; ";
145 
146  //
147  // Run script engine handler
148  //
149  CodeBuffer = ScriptEngineParseWrapper((char *)Command.c_str());
150 
151  if (CodeBuffer == NULL)
152  {
153  //
154  // return to show that this item contains an script
155  //
156  return;
157  }
158 
159  //
160  // Print symbols (test)
161  //
162  // PrintSymbolBufferWrapper(CodeBuffer);
163 
164  //
165  // Set the buffer and length
166  //
167  BufferAddress = ScriptEngineWrapperGetHead(CodeBuffer);
168  BufferLength = ScriptEngineWrapperGetSize(CodeBuffer);
169  Pointer = ScriptEngineWrapperGetPointer(CodeBuffer);
170 
171  //
172  // Send it to the remote debuggee
173  //
174  KdSendScriptPacketToDebuggee(BufferAddress, BufferLength, Pointer, TRUE);
175 
176  //
177  // Remove the buffer of script engine interpreted code
178  //
179  ScriptEngineWrapperRemoveSymbolBuffer(CodeBuffer);
180  }
181  else
182  {
183  //
184  // The user is either in VMI-mode or not connected to debuggee,
185  // in this state, we will support .formats for constant values
186  // not register, or expression
187  //
188  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
189  {
190  ShowMessages("err, only one constant value is allowed when you're not connected to a debuggee\n\n");
191  CommandFormatsHelp();
192  return;
193  }
194 
195  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(SplittedCommand.at(1), &ConstantValue))
196  {
197  //
198  // Unkonwn parameter
199  //
200  ShowMessages("err, unknown parameter '%s'\nwhile you're not connected to any debuggee (Debugger Mode), "
201  "you can only use a constant value in the '.formats' and you're not allowed to use registers "
202  "or expressions\n\n",
203  SplittedCommand.at(1).c_str());
204  return;
205  }
206 
207  //
208  // Show formats results for a constant
209  //
210  CommandFormatsShowResults(ConstantValue);
211  }
212 }

VOID CommandFormatsHelp()
help of help command :)

◆ CommandHide()

VOID CommandHide ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!hide command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
54 {
55  BOOLEAN Status;
56  ULONG ReturnedLength;
57  UINT64 TargetPid;
58  BOOLEAN TrueIfProcessIdAndFalseIfProcessName;
59  DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE HideRequest = {0};
60  PDEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE FinalRequestBuffer = 0;
61  size_t RequestBufferSize = 0;
62 
63  if (SplittedCommand.size() <= 2)
64  {
65  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!hide'\n\n");
66  CommandHideHelp();
67  return;
68  }
69 
70  //
71  // Find out whether the user enters pid or name
72  //
73  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("pid"))
74  {
75  TrueIfProcessIdAndFalseIfProcessName = TRUE;
76 
77  //
78  // Check for the user to not add extra arguments
79  //
80  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 3)
81  {
82  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!hide'\n\n");
83  CommandHideHelp();
84  return;
85  }
86 
87  //
88  // It's just a pid for the process
89  //
90  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(SplittedCommand.at(2), &TargetPid))
91  {
92  ShowMessages("incorrect process id\n\n");
93  return;
94  }
95  }
96  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("name"))
97  {
98  TrueIfProcessIdAndFalseIfProcessName = FALSE;
99 
100  //
101  // Trim the command
102  //
103  Trim(Command);
104 
105  //
106  // Remove !hide from it
107  //
108  Command.erase(0, 5);
109 
110  //
111  // remove name + space
112  //
113  Command.erase(0, 4 + 1);
114 
115  //
116  // Trim it again
117  //
118  Trim(Command);
119  }
120  else
121  {
122  //
123  // Invalid argument for the second parameter to the command
124  //
125  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!hide'\n\n");
126  CommandHideHelp();
127  return;
128  }
129 
130  //
131  // Check if the user used !measure or not
132  //
133  if (!g_TransparentResultsMeasured || !g_CpuidAverage ||
134  !g_CpuidStandardDeviation || !g_CpuidMedian)
135  {
136  ShowMessages("the average, median and standard deviation is not measured. "
137  "Did you use '!measure' command?\n");
138  return;
139  }
140 
141  //
142  // Check if debugger is loaded or not
143  //
144  if (!g_DeviceHandle)
145  {
146  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
147  "use 'load' command?\n");
148  return;
149  }
150 
151  //
152  // We wanna hide the debugger and make transparent vm-exits
153  //
154  HideRequest.IsHide = TRUE;
155 
156  //
157  // Set the measured times cpuid
158  //
159  HideRequest.CpuidAverage = g_CpuidAverage;
160  HideRequest.CpuidMedian = g_CpuidMedian;
161  HideRequest.CpuidStandardDeviation = g_CpuidStandardDeviation;
162 
163  //
164  // Set the measured times rdtsc/p
165  //
166  HideRequest.RdtscAverage = g_RdtscAverage;
167  HideRequest.RdtscMedian = g_RdtscMedian;
168  HideRequest.RdtscStandardDeviation = g_RdtscStandardDeviation;
169 
170  HideRequest.TrueIfProcessIdAndFalseIfProcessName =
171  TrueIfProcessIdAndFalseIfProcessName;
172 
173  if (TrueIfProcessIdAndFalseIfProcessName)
174  {
175  //
176  // It's a process id
177  //
178  HideRequest.ProcId = TargetPid;
179 
180  RequestBufferSize = sizeof(DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE);
181  }
182  else
183  {
184  //
185  // It's a process name
186  //
187  HideRequest.LengthOfProcessName = Command.size() + 1;
188  RequestBufferSize = sizeof(DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE) +
189  Command.size() + 1;
190  }
191 
192  //
193  // Allocate the requested buffer
194  //
195  FinalRequestBuffer =
196  (PDEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE)malloc(RequestBufferSize);
197 
198  //
199  // Zero the memory
200  //
201  RtlZeroMemory(FinalRequestBuffer, RequestBufferSize);
202 
203  //
204  // Copy the buffer on the top of the final buffer
205  // to send the kernel
206  //
207  memcpy(FinalRequestBuffer, &HideRequest, sizeof(DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE));
208 
209  //
210  // If it's a name then we should add it to the end of the buffer
211  //
212  memcpy(((UINT64 *)((UINT64)FinalRequestBuffer +
213  sizeof(DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE))),
214  Command.c_str(),
215  Command.size());
216 
217  //
218  // Send the request to the kernel
219  //
220 
221  Status = DeviceIoControl(
222  g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
223  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_UNHIDE_TO_TRANSPARENT_THE_DEBUGGER, // IO Control
224  // code
225  FinalRequestBuffer, // Input Buffer to driver.
226  RequestBufferSize, // Input buffer length
227  FinalRequestBuffer, // Output Buffer from driver.
228  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE, // Length of output
229  // buffer in bytes.
230  &ReturnedLength, // Bytes placed in buffer.
231  NULL // synchronous call
232  );
233 
234  if (!Status)
235  {
236  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code 0x%x\n", GetLastError());
237  free(FinalRequestBuffer);
238  return;
239  }
240 
241  if (FinalRequestBuffer->KernelStatus == DEBUGEER_OPERATION_WAS_SUCCESSFULL)
242  {
243  ShowMessages("transparent debugging successfully enabled :)\n");
244  }
245  else if (FinalRequestBuffer->KernelStatus ==
246  DEBUGEER_ERROR_UNABLE_TO_HIDE_OR_UNHIDE_DEBUGGER)
247  {
248  ShowMessages("unable to hide the debugger (transparent-debugging) :(\n");
249  free(FinalRequestBuffer);
250  return;
251  }
252  else
253  {
254  ShowMessages("unknown error occurred :(\n");
255  free(FinalRequestBuffer);
256  return;
257  }
258 
259  //
260  // free the buffer
261  //
262  free(FinalRequestBuffer);
263 }
g_CpuidStandardDeviation
UINT64 g_CpuidStandardDeviation
The standard deviation calculated from the measurements of cpuid '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:407
g_RdtscAverage
UINT64 g_RdtscAverage
The average calculated from the measurements of rdtsc/p '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:419
g_RdtscMedian
UINT64 g_RdtscMedian
The median calculated from the measurements of rdtsc/p '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:431
g_TransparentResultsMeasured
BOOLEAN g_TransparentResultsMeasured
Shows whether the user executed and mesaured '!measure' command or not, it is because we want to use ...
Definition: globals.h:395
CommandHideHelp
VOID CommandHideHelp()
help of !hide command
Definition: hide.cpp:33
g_CpuidMedian
UINT64 g_CpuidMedian
The median calculated from the measurements of cpuid '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:413
g_RdtscStandardDeviation
UINT64 g_RdtscStandardDeviation
The standard deviation calculated from the measurements of rdtsc/p '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:425

UINT64 g_CpuidAverage
The average calculated from the measurements of cpuid '!measure' command.

◆ CommandI()

VOID CommandI ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of i command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
49 {
50  UINT32 StepCount;
51  DEBUGGER_REMOTE_STEPPING_REQUEST RequestFormat;
52 
53  //
54  // Validate the commands
55  //
56  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1 && SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
57  {
58  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'i'\n\n");
59  CommandIHelp();
60  return;
61  }
62 
63  //
64  // Set type of step
65  //
66  RequestFormat = DEBUGGER_REMOTE_STEPPING_REQUEST_STEP_IN_INSTRUMENT;
67 
68  //
69  // Check if the command has a counter parameter
70  //
71  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
72  {
73  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(SplittedCommand.at(1), &StepCount))
74  {
75  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for [count]\n\n");
76  CommandIHelp();
77  return;
78  }
79  }
80  else
81  {
82  StepCount = 1;
83  }
84 
85  //
86  // Check if the remote serial debuggee is paused or not
87  //
88  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
89  {
90  for (size_t i = 0; i < StepCount; i++)
91  {
92  KdSendStepPacketToDebuggee(RequestFormat);
93 
94  if (!SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("ir"))
95  {
96  //
97  // Show registers
98  //
99  ShowAllRegisters();
100  if (i != StepCount - 1)
101  {
102  ShowMessages("\n");
103  }
104  }
105  }
106  }
107  else
108  {
109  ShowMessages("err, stepping (i) is not valid in the current context, you "
110  "should connect to a debuggee\n");
111  }
112 }
ShowAllRegisters
VOID ShowAllRegisters()
handler of r show all registers command
Definition: r.cpp:78
CommandIHelp
VOID CommandIHelp()
help of i command
Definition: i.cpp:25
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee

Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)
Definition: globals.h:171
KdSendStepPacketToDebuggee
BOOLEAN KdSendStepPacketToDebuggee(DEBUGGER_REMOTE_STEPPING_REQUEST StepRequestType)
Sends p (step out) and t (step in) packet to the debuggee.

◆ CommandInterrupt()

VOID CommandInterrupt ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!interrupt command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
43 {
44  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
45  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
47  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
48  UINT32 EventLength;
49  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
50  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
51  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
52  UINT64 SpecialTarget = 0;
53  BOOLEAN GetEntry = FALSE;
54  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
55 
56  //
57  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
58  //
59  //
60  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
61  &SplittedCommand,
62  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
63  EXTERNAL_INTERRUPT_OCCURRED,
64  &Event,
65  &EventLength,
66  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
67  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
68  &ActionCustomCode,
69  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
70  &ActionScript,
71  &ActionScriptLength))
72  {
73  CommandInterruptHelp();
74  return;
75  }
76 
77  //
78  // Interpret command specific details (if any)
79  //
80  //
81  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
82  {
83  if (!Section.compare("!interrupt"))
84  {
85  continue;
86  }
87  else if (!GetEntry)
88  {
89  //
90  // It's probably an index
91  //
92  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &SpecialTarget))
93  {
94  //
95  // Unkonwn parameter
96  //
97  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
98  CommandInterruptHelp();
99  return;
100  }
101  else
102  {
103  //
104  // Check if entry is valid or not
105  //
106  if (!(SpecialTarget >= 32 && SpecialTarget <= 0xff))
107  {
108  //
109  // Entry is invalid (this command is designed for just entries
110  // between 32 to 255)
111  //
112  ShowMessages("the entry should be between 0x20 to 0xFF or the "
113  "entries between 32 to 255\n\n");
114  CommandInterruptHelp();
115  return;
116  }
117  GetEntry = TRUE;
118  }
119  }
120  else
121  {
122  //
123  // Unkonwn parameter
124  //
125  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
126  CommandInterruptHelp();
127  return;
128  }
129  }
130 
131  if (SpecialTarget == 0)
132  {
133  //
134  // The user didn't set the target interrupt, even though it's possible to
135  // get all interrupts but it makes the system not resposive so it's wrong
136  // to trigger event on all interrupts and we're not going to support it
137  //
138  ShowMessages("please specify an interrupt index to monitor, HyperDbg "
139  "doesn't support to trigger events on all interrupts because "
140  "it's not reasonable and make the system unresponsive\n");
141  CommandInterruptHelp();
142  return;
143  }
144 
145  //
146  // Set the target interrupt
147  //
148  Event->OptionalParam1 = SpecialTarget;
149 
150  //
151  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
152  //
153  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
154  {
155  //
156  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
157  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
158  // already freed the Event and string buffers
159  //
160  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
161  {
162  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
163  }
164  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
165  {
166  free(ActionCustomCode);
167  }
168  if (ActionScript != NULL)
169  {
170  free(ActionScript);
171  }
172  return;
173  }
174 
175  //
176  // Add the event to the kernel
177  //
178  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
179  {
180  //
181  // There was an error
182  //
183  return;
184  }
185 }
CommandInterruptHelp
VOID CommandInterruptHelp()
help of !interrupt command
Definition: interrupt.cpp:20

◆ CommandIoin()

VOID CommandIoin ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!ioin command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
45 {
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
47  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
48  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
49  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
50  UINT32 EventLength;
51  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
52  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
53  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
54  UINT64 SpecialTarget = DEBUGGER_EVENT_ALL_IO_PORTS;
55  BOOLEAN GetPort = FALSE;
56  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
57 
58  //
59  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
60  //
61  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
62  &SplittedCommand,
63  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
64  IN_INSTRUCTION_EXECUTION,
65  &Event,
66  &EventLength,
67  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
68  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
69  &ActionCustomCode,
70  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
71  &ActionScript,
72  &ActionScriptLength))
73  {
74  CommandIoinHelp();
75  return;
76  }
77 
78  //
79  // Interpret command specific details (if any)
80  //
81  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
82  {
83  if (!Section.compare("!ioin"))
84  {
85  continue;
86  }
87  else if (!GetPort)
88  {
89  //
90  // It's probably an I/O port
91  //
92  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &SpecialTarget))
93  {
94  //
95  // Unkonwn parameter
96  //
97  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
98  CommandIoinHelp();
99  return;
100  }
101  else
102  {
103  GetPort = TRUE;
104  }
105  }
106  else
107  {
108  //
109  // Unkonwn parameter
110  //
111  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
112  CommandIoinHelp();
113  return;
114  }
115  }
116 
117  //
118  // Set the target I/O port
119  //
120  Event->OptionalParam1 = SpecialTarget;
121 
122  //
123  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
124  //
125  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
126  {
127  //
128  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
129  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
130  // already freed the Event and string buffers
131  //
132  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
133  {
134  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
135  }
136  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
137  {
138  free(ActionCustomCode);
139  }
140  if (ActionScript != NULL)
141  {
142  free(ActionScript);
143  }
144  return;
145  }
146 
147  //
148  // Add the event to the kernel
149  //
150  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
151  {
152  //
153  // There was an error
154  //
155  return;
156  }
157 }
CommandIoinHelp
VOID CommandIoinHelp()
help of !ioin command
Definition: ioin.cpp:20

◆ CommandIoout()

VOID CommandIoout ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,

)

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
45 {
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
47  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
48  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
49  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
50  UINT32 EventLength;
51  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
52  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
53  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
54  UINT64 SpecialTarget = DEBUGGER_EVENT_ALL_IO_PORTS;
55  BOOLEAN GetPort = FALSE;
56  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
57 
58  //
59  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
60  //
61  //
62  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
63  &SplittedCommand,
64  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
65  OUT_INSTRUCTION_EXECUTION,
66  &Event,
67  &EventLength,
68  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
69  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
70  &ActionCustomCode,
71  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
72  &ActionScript,
73  &ActionScriptLength))
74  {
75  CommandIooutHelp();
76  return;
77  }
78 
79  //
80  // Interpret command specific details (if any)
81  //
82  //
83  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
84  {
85  if (!Section.compare("!ioout"))
86  {
87  continue;
88  }
89  else if (!GetPort)
90  {
91  //
92  // It's probably an I/O port
93  //
94  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &SpecialTarget))
95  {
96  //
97  // Unkonwn parameter
98  //
99  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
100  CommandIooutHelp();
101  return;
102  }
103  else
104  {
105  GetPort = TRUE;
106  }
107  }
108  else
109  {
110  //
111  // Unkonwn parameter
112  //
113  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
114  CommandIooutHelp();
115  return;
116  }
117  }
118 
119  //
120  // Set the target I/O port
121  //
122  Event->OptionalParam1 = SpecialTarget;
123 
124  //
125  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
126  //
127  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
128  {
129  //
130  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
131  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
132  // already freed the Event and string buffers
133  //
134  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
135  {
136  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
137  }
138  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
139  {
140  free(ActionCustomCode);
141  }
142  if (ActionScript != NULL)
143  {
144  free(ActionScript);
145  }
146  return;
147  }
148 
149  //
150  // Add the event to the kernel
151  //
152  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
153  {
154  //
155  // There was an error
156  //
157  return;
158  }
159 }

◆ CommandListen()

VOID CommandListen ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

listen command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
52 {
53  string port;
54 
55  if (SplittedCommand.size() >= 3)
56  {
57  //
58  // Means that user entered invalid parameters
59  //
60  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.listen'\n\n");
61  CommandListenHelp();
62  return;
63  }
64 
65  if (g_IsConnectedToHyperDbgLocally || g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebuggee ||
66  g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
67  {
68  ShowMessages("you're connected to a debugger, please use '.disconnect' "
69  "command\n");
70  return;
71  }
72 
73  //
74  // Check to avoid using this command in debugger-mode
75  //
76  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee || g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
77  {
78  ShowMessages("you're connected to a an instance of HyperDbg, please use "
79  "'.debug close' command\n");
80  return;
81  }
82 
83  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
84  {
85  //
86  // listen on default port
87  //
88  ShowMessages("listening on %s ...\n", DEFAULT_PORT);
89  RemoteConnectionListen(DEFAULT_PORT);
90 
91  return;
92  }
93  else if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
94  {
95  port = SplittedCommand.at(1);
96 
97  //
98  // means that probably wants to listen
99  // on a specific port, let's see if the
100  // port is valid or not
101  //
102  if (!IsNumber(port) || stoi(port) > 65535 || stoi(port) < 0)
103  {
104  ShowMessages("incorrect port\n");
105  return;
106  }
107 
108  //
109  // listen on the port
110  //
111  ShowMessages("listening on %s ...\n", port.c_str());
112  RemoteConnectionListen(port.c_str());
113  }
114  else
115  {
116  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.listen'\n\n");
117  CommandListenHelp();
118  return;
119  }
120 }

◆ CommandLm()

VOID CommandLm ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handle lm command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
43 {
44  PRTL_PROCESS_MODULES ModuleInfo;
45  NTSTATUS Status;
46  ULONG i;
47  char * Search;
48 
49  if (SplittedCommand.size() >= 3)
50  {
51  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'lm'\n\n");
52  CommandLmHelp();
53  return;
54  }
55 
56  //
57  // Allocate memory for the module list
58  //
59  ModuleInfo = (PRTL_PROCESS_MODULES)VirtualAlloc(
60  NULL,
61  1024 * 1024,
62  MEM_COMMIT | MEM_RESERVE,
63  PAGE_READWRITE);
64 
65  if (!ModuleInfo)
66  {
67  ShowMessages("\nUnable to allocate memory for module list (%d)\n",
68  GetLastError());
69  return;
70  }
71 
72  //
73  // 11 = SystemModuleInformation
74  //
75  if (!NT_SUCCESS(
76  Status = NtQuerySystemInformation((SYSTEM_INFORMATION_CLASS)11,
77  ModuleInfo,
78  1024 * 1024,
79  NULL)))
80  {
81  ShowMessages("\nError: Unable to query module list (%#x)\n", Status);
82 
83  VirtualFree(ModuleInfo, 0, MEM_RELEASE);
84  return;
85  }
86 
87  ShowMessages("start\t\t\tsize\tname\t\t\t\tpath\n\n");
88 
89  for (i = 0; i < ModuleInfo->NumberOfModules; i++)
90  {
91  //
92  // Check if we need to search for the module or not
93  //
94  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
95  {
96  Search = strstr((char *)ModuleInfo->Modules[i].FullPathName,
97  SplittedCommand.at(1).c_str());
98  if (Search == NULL)
99  {
100  //
101  // not found
102  //
103  continue;
104  }
105  }
106 
107  ShowMessages("%s\t", SeparateTo64BitValue((UINT64)ModuleInfo->Modules[i].ImageBase).c_str());
108  ShowMessages("%x\t", ModuleInfo->Modules[i].ImageSize);
109 
110  auto PathName = ModuleInfo->Modules[i].FullPathName + ModuleInfo->Modules[i].OffsetToFileName;
111  UINT32 PathNameLen = strlen((const char *)PathName);
112 
113  ShowMessages("%s\t", PathName);
114 
115  if (PathNameLen >= 24)
116  {
117  }
118  else if (PathNameLen >= 16)
119  {
120  ShowMessages("\t");
121  }
122  else if (PathNameLen >= 8)
123  {
124  ShowMessages("\t\t");
125  }
126  else
127  {
128  ShowMessages("\t\t\t");
129  }
130 
131  ShowMessages("%s\n", ModuleInfo->Modules[i].FullPathName);
132  }
133 
134  VirtualFree(ModuleInfo, 0, MEM_RELEASE);
135 }
SYSTEM_INFORMATION_CLASS
enum _SYSTEM_INFORMATION_CLASS SYSTEM_INFORMATION_CLASS
SeparateTo64BitValue
string SeparateTo64BitValue(UINT64 Value)
add ` between 64 bit values and convert them to string
Definition: common.cpp:21

Definition: lm.cpp:22

◆ CommandLoad()

VOID CommandLoad ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

load command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
118 {
119  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
120  {
121  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'load'\n\n");
122  CommandLoadHelp();
123  return;
124  }
125 
126  if (!g_IsConnectedToHyperDbgLocally)
127  {
128  ShowMessages("you're not connected to any instance of HyperDbg, did you "
129  "use '.connect'? \n");
130  return;
131  }
132 
133  //
134  // Check for the module
135  //
136  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("vmm"))
137  {
138  //
139  // Check to make sure that the driver is not already loaded
140  //
141  if (g_DeviceHandle)
142  {
143  ShowMessages("handle of the driver found, if you use 'load' before, please "
144  "first unload it then call 'unload'\n");
145  return;
146  }
147 
148  //
149  // Load VMM Module
150  //
151  ShowMessages("loading the vmm driver\n");
152 
153  if (!CommandLoadVmmModule())
154  {
155  ShowMessages("failed to install or load the driver\n");
156  return;
157  }
158 
159  //
160  // If in vmi-mode then initialize and load symbols (pdb)
161  // for previously downloaded symbols
162  //
163  SymbolInitialReload();
164  }
165  else
166  {
167  //
168  // Module not found
169  //
170  ShowMessages("module not found, currently 'vmm' is the only available "
171  "module for HyperDbg\n");
172  }
173 }

41 {
42  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1)
43  {
44  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.logclose'\n\n");
45  CommandLogcloseHelp();
46  return;
47  }
48  if (!g_LogOpened)
49  {
50  ShowMessages("there is no opened log, did you use '.logopen'? \n");
51  return;
52  }
53 
54  //
55  // Show the time and message before close
56  //
57  time_t t = time(NULL);
58  struct tm tm = *localtime(&t);
59  ShowMessages("log file closed (%d-%02d-%02d "
60  "%02d:%02d:%02d)\n",
61  tm.tm_year + 1900,
62  tm.tm_mon + 1,
63  tm.tm_mday,
64  tm.tm_hour,
65  tm.tm_min,
66  tm.tm_sec);
67  //
68  // close the file
69  //
70  g_LogOpenFile.close();
71 
72  //
73  // Globally indicate that file is no longer available
74  //
75  g_LogOpened = FALSE;
76 }

◆ CommandLogopen()

VOID CommandLogopen ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

.logopen command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
43 {
44  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
45  {
46  ShowMessages("please specify a file\n");
47  CommandLogopenHelp();
48  return;
49  }
50 
51  if (g_LogOpened)
52  {
53  ShowMessages("log was opened previously, you have the close it first "
54  "(using .logclose)\n");
55  return;
56  }
57 
58  //
59  // Trim the command
60  //
61  Trim(Command);
62 
63  //
64  // Remove .logopen from it
65  //
66  Command.erase(0, 8);
67 
68  //
69  // Trim it again
70  //
71  Trim(Command);
72 
73  //
74  // Try to open it as file
75  //
76  g_LogOpenFile.open(Command.c_str());
77 
78  //
79  // Check if it's okay
80  //
81  if (g_LogOpenFile.is_open())
82  {
83  //
84  // Start intercepting logs
85  //
86  g_LogOpened = TRUE;
87 
88  //
89  // Enable save to the file (Message + time)
90  //
91  time_t t = time(NULL);
92  struct tm tm = *localtime(&t);
93 
94  ShowMessages("save commands and results into file : %s (%d-%02d-%02d "
95  "%02d:%02d:%02d)\n",
96  Command.c_str(),
97  tm.tm_year + 1900,
98  tm.tm_mon + 1,
99  tm.tm_mday,
100  tm.tm_hour,
101  tm.tm_min,
102  tm.tm_sec);
103  }
104  else
105  {
106  ShowMessages("unable to open file : %s\n", Command.c_str());
107  return;
108  }
109 }
