◆ CommandMeasure()

VOID CommandMeasure ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!measure command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
51 {
52  BOOLEAN DefaultMode = FALSE;
53 
54  if (SplittedCommand.size() >= 3)
55  {
56  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!measure'\n\n");
57  CommandMeasureHelp();
58  return;
59  }
60 
61  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2 && SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("default"))
62  {
63  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!measure'\n\n");
64  CommandMeasureHelp();
65  return;
66  }
67  else if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2 &&
68  !SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("default"))
69  {
70  DefaultMode = TRUE;
71  }
72 
73  //
74  // Check if debugger is loaded or not
75  //
76  if (g_DeviceHandle && !DefaultMode)
77  {
78  ShowMessages(
79  "Debugger is loaded and your machine is already in a hypervisor, you "
80  "should measure the times before 'load'-ing the debugger, please "
81  "'unload' the debugger and use '!measure' again or use '!measure "
82  "default' to use hardcoded measurements\n");
83  return;
84  }
85 
86  if (!DefaultMode)
87  {
88  if (TransparentModeCheckHypervisorPresence(
89  &g_CpuidAverage,
90  &g_CpuidStandardDeviation,
91  &g_CpuidMedian))
92  {
93  ShowMessages(
94  "we detected that there is a hypervisor, on your system, it "
95  "leads to wrong measurement results for our transparent-mode, please "
96  "make sure that you're not in a hypervisor then measure the result "
97  "again; otherwise the transparent-mode will not work but you can use "
98  "'!measure default' to use the hardcoded measurements !\n\n");
99 
100  return;
101  }
102 
103  if (TransparentModeCheckRdtscpVmexit(
104  &g_RdtscAverage,
105  &g_RdtscStandardDeviation,
106  &g_RdtscMedian))
107  {
108  ShowMessages(
109  "we detected that there is a hypervisor, on your system, it "
110  "leads to wrong measurement results for our transparent-mode, please "
111  "make sure that you're not in a hypervisor then measure the result "
112  "again; otherwise the transparent-mode will not work but you can use "
113  "'!measure default' to use the hardcoded measurements !\n\n");
114 
115  return;
116  }
117  }
118  else
119  {
120  //
121  // It's a default mode
122  //
123 
124  //
125  // Default values for cpuid
126  //
127  g_CpuidAverage = 0x5f;
128  g_CpuidStandardDeviation = 0x10;
129  g_CpuidMedian = 0x5f;
130 
131  //
132  // Default values for rdtsc/p
133  //
134  g_RdtscAverage = 0x16;
135  g_RdtscStandardDeviation = 0x5;
136  g_RdtscMedian = 0x16;
137  }
138 
139  ShowMessages("the measurements was successful, now you can use '!hide' command\n");
140 
141  //
142  // Indicate that the measurements was successful
143  //
144  g_TransparentResultsMeasured = TRUE;
145 }
g_CpuidStandardDeviation
UINT64 g_CpuidStandardDeviation
The standard deviation calculated from the measurements of cpuid '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:407
g_RdtscAverage
UINT64 g_RdtscAverage
The average calculated from the measurements of rdtsc/p '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:419
CommandMeasureHelp
VOID CommandMeasureHelp()
help of !measure command
Definition: measure.cpp:33
g_RdtscMedian
UINT64 g_RdtscMedian
The median calculated from the measurements of rdtsc/p '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:431
g_TransparentResultsMeasured
BOOLEAN g_TransparentResultsMeasured
Shows whether the user executed and mesaured '!measure' command or not, it is because we want to use ...
Definition: globals.h:395
g_CpuidMedian
UINT64 g_CpuidMedian
The median calculated from the measurements of cpuid '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:413
g_RdtscStandardDeviation
UINT64 g_RdtscStandardDeviation
The standard deviation calculated from the measurements of rdtsc/p '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:425
g_CpuidAverage
UINT64 g_CpuidAverage
The average calculated from the measurements of cpuid '!measure' command.
Definition: globals.h:401
TransparentModeCheckRdtscpVmexit
BOOLEAN TransparentModeCheckRdtscpVmexit(UINT64 *Average, UINT64 *StandardDeviation, UINT64 *Median)
compute the average, standard deviation and median if rdtsc+rdtsc
Definition: transparency.cpp:226
TransparentModeCheckHypervisorPresence
BOOLEAN TransparentModeCheckHypervisorPresence(UINT64 *Average, UINT64 *StandardDeviation, UINT64 *Median)
compute the average, standard deviation and median if rdtsc+cpuid+rdtsc
Definition: transparency.cpp:196

◆ CommandMonitor()

VOID CommandMonitor ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!monitor command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
45 {
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
47  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
48  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
49  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
50  UINT32 EventLength;
51  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
52  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
53  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
54  UINT64 TargetAddress;
55  UINT64 OptionalParam1 = 0; // Set the 'from' target address
56  UINT64 OptionalParam2 = 0; // Set the 'to' target address
57  BOOLEAN SetFrom = FALSE;
58  BOOLEAN SetTo = FALSE;
59  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
60  UINT32 IndexInCommandCaseSensitive = 0;
61 
62  if (SplittedCommand.size() < 4)
63  {
64  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!monitor'\n");
65  CommandMonitorHelp();
66  return;
67  }
68 
69  //
70  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
71  //
72  // We use HIDDEN_HOOK_READ_AND_WRITE here but it might be changed to
73  // HIDDEN_HOOK_READ or HIDDEN_HOOK_WRITE it is because we are not sure what
74  // kind event the user need
75  //
76  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
77  &SplittedCommand,
78  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
79  HIDDEN_HOOK_READ_AND_WRITE,
80  &Event,
81  &EventLength,
82  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
83  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
84  &ActionCustomCode,
85  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
86  &ActionScript,
87  &ActionScriptLength))
88  {
89  CommandMonitorHelp();
90  return;
91  }
92 
93  //
94  // Interpret command specific details (if any)
95  //
96  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
97  {
98  IndexInCommandCaseSensitive++;
99 
100  if (!Section.compare("!monitor"))
101  {
102  continue;
103  }
104  else if (!Section.compare("r"))
105  {
106  Event->EventType = HIDDEN_HOOK_READ;
107  }
108  else if (!Section.compare("w"))
109  {
110  Event->EventType = HIDDEN_HOOK_WRITE;
111  }
112  else if (!Section.compare("rw") || !Section.compare("wr"))
113  {
114  Event->EventType = HIDDEN_HOOK_READ_AND_WRITE;
115  }
116  else
117  {
118  //
119  // It's probably address
120  //
121  if (!SetFrom)
122  {
123  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(
124  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1),
125  &OptionalParam1))
126  {
127  //
128  // couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
129  //
130  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
131  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1).c_str());
132  CommandMonitorHelp();
133  return;
134  }
135  SetFrom = TRUE;
136  }
137  else if (!SetTo)
138  {
139  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(
140  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1),
141  &OptionalParam2))
142  {
143  //
144  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
145  //
146  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
147  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1).c_str());
148 
149  CommandMonitorHelp();
150  return;
151  }
152  SetTo = TRUE;
153  }
154  else
155  {
156  //
157  // Unkonwn parameter
158  //
159  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
160  CommandMonitorHelp();
161  return;
162  }
163  }
164  }
165  if (OptionalParam1 > OptionalParam2)
166  {
167  //
168  // 'from' is greater than 'to'
169  //
170  ShowMessages("please choose the 'from' value first, then choose the 'to' "
171  "value\n");
172  return;
173  }
174 
175  //
176  // Set the optional parameters
177  //
178  Event->OptionalParam1 = OptionalParam1;
179  Event->OptionalParam2 = OptionalParam2;
180 
181  //
182  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
183  //
184  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
185  {
186  //
187  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
188  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
189  // already freed the Event and string buffers
190  //
191  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
192  {
193  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
194  }
195  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
196  {
197  free(ActionCustomCode);
198  }
199  if (ActionScript != NULL)
200  {
201  free(ActionScript);
202  }
203  return;
204  }
205 
206  //
207  // Add the event to the kernel
208  //
209  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
210  {
211  //
212  // There was an error
213  //
214  return;
215  }
216 }
CommandMonitorHelp
VOID CommandMonitorHelp()
help of !monitor command
Definition: monitor.cpp:20

◆ CommandMsrread()

VOID CommandMsrread ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!msrread command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
44 {
45  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
47  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
48  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
49  UINT32 EventLength;
50  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
51  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
52  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
53  UINT64 SpecialTarget = DEBUGGER_EVENT_MSR_READ_OR_WRITE_ALL_MSRS;
54  BOOLEAN GetAddress = FALSE;
55  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
56 
57  //
58  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
59  //
60  //
61  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
62  &SplittedCommand,
63  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
64  RDMSR_INSTRUCTION_EXECUTION,
65  &Event,
66  &EventLength,
67  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
68  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
69  &ActionCustomCode,
70  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
71  &ActionScript,
72  &ActionScriptLength))
73  {
74  CommandMsrreadHelp();
75  return;
76  }
77 
78  //
79  // Interpret command specific details (if any), it is because we can use
80  // special msr bitmap here
81  //
82  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
83  {
84  if (!Section.compare("!msrread"))
85  {
86  continue;
87  }
88  else if (!GetAddress)
89  {
90  //
91  // It's probably an msr
92  //
93  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &SpecialTarget))
94  {
95  //
96  // Unkonwn parameter
97  //
98  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
99  CommandMsrreadHelp();
100  return;
101  }
102  else
103  {
104  GetAddress = TRUE;
105  }
106  }
107  else
108  {
109  //
110  // Unkonwn parameter
111  //
112  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
113  CommandMsrreadHelp();
114  return;
115  }
116  }
117 
118  //
119  // Set the target msr (if not specific then it means all msrs)
120  //
121  Event->OptionalParam1 = SpecialTarget;
122 
123  //
124  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
125  //
126  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
127  {
128  //
129  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
130  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
131  // already freed the Event and string buffers
132  //
133  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
134  {
135  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
136  }
137  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
138  {
139  free(ActionCustomCode);
140  }
141  if (ActionScript != NULL)
142  {
143  free(ActionScript);
144  }
145  return;
146  }
147 
148  //
149  // Add the event to the kernel
150  //
151  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
152  {
153  //
154  // There was an error
155  //
156  return;
157  }
158 }
CommandMsrreadHelp
VOID CommandMsrreadHelp()
help of !msrread command
Definition: msrread.cpp:20

◆ CommandMsrwrite()

VOID CommandMsrwrite ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!msrwrite command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
44 {
45  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
47  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
48  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
49  UINT32 EventLength;
50  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
51  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
52  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
53  UINT64 SpecialTarget = DEBUGGER_EVENT_MSR_READ_OR_WRITE_ALL_MSRS;
54  BOOLEAN GetAddress = FALSE;
55  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
56 
57  //
58  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
59  //
60  //
61  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
62  &SplittedCommand,
63  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
64  WRMSR_INSTRUCTION_EXECUTION,
65  &Event,
66  &EventLength,
67  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
68  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
69  &ActionCustomCode,
70  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
71  &ActionScript,
72  &ActionScriptLength))
73  {
74  CommandMsrwriteHelp();
75  return;
76  }
77 
78  //
79  // Interpret command specific details (if any), it is because we can use
80  // special msr bitmap here
81  //
82  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
83  {
84  if (!Section.compare("!msrwrite"))
85  {
86  continue;
87  }
88  else if (!GetAddress)
89  {
90  //
91  // It's probably an msr
92  //
93  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &SpecialTarget))
94  {
95  //
96  // Unkonwn parameter
97  //
98  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
99  CommandMsrwriteHelp();
100  return;
101  }
102  else
103  {
104  GetAddress = TRUE;
105  }
106  }
107  else
108  {
109  //
110  // Unkonwn parameter
111  //
112  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
113  CommandMsrwriteHelp();
114  return;
115  }
116  }
117 
118  //
119  // Set the target msr (if not specific then it means all msrs)
120  //
121  Event->OptionalParam1 = SpecialTarget;
122 
123  //
124  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
125  //
126  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
127  {
128  //
129  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
130  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
131  // already freed the Event and string buffers
132  //
133  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
134  {
135  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
136  }
137  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
138  {
139  free(ActionCustomCode);
140  }
141  if (ActionScript != NULL)
142  {
143  free(ActionScript);
144  }
145  return;
146  }
147 
148  //
149  // Add the event to the kernel
150  //
151  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
152  {
153  //
154  // There was an error
155  //
156  return;
157  }
158 }
CommandMsrwriteHelp
VOID CommandMsrwriteHelp()

◆ CommandOutput()

VOID CommandOutput ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

output command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
50 {
51  PDEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING EventForwardingObject;
52  DEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING_TYPE Type;
53  DEBUGGER_OUTPUT_SOURCE_STATUS Status;
54  string DetailsOfSource;
55  UINT32 IndexToShowList;
56  PLIST_ENTRY TempList = 0;
57  BOOLEAN OutputSourceFound = FALSE;
58  HANDLE SourceHandle = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
59  SOCKET Socket = NULL;
60  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
61 
62  //
63  // Check if the user needs a list of outputs or not
64  //
65  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
66  {
67  IndexToShowList = 0;
68 
69  if (g_OutputSourcesInitialized)
70  {
71  TempList = &g_OutputSources;
72 
73  while (&g_OutputSources != TempList->Blink)
74  {
75  TempList = TempList->Blink;
76 
77  PDEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING CurrentOutputSourceDetails =
78  CONTAINING_RECORD(TempList, DEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING, OutputSourcesList);
79 
80  //
81  // Increase index
82  //
83  IndexToShowList++;
84 
85  string TempStateString = "";
86  string TempTypeString = "";
87 
88  if (CurrentOutputSourceDetails->State ==
89  EVENT_FORWARDING_STATE_NOT_OPENED)
90  {
91  TempStateString = "not opened";
92  }
93  else if (CurrentOutputSourceDetails->State ==
94  EVENT_FORWARDING_STATE_OPENED)
95  {
96  TempStateString = "opened ";
97  }
98  else if (CurrentOutputSourceDetails->State ==
99  EVENT_FORWARDING_CLOSED)
100  {
101  TempStateString = "closed ";
102  }
103 
104  if (CurrentOutputSourceDetails->Type == EVENT_FORWARDING_NAMEDPIPE)
105  {
106  TempTypeString = "namedpipe";
107  }
108  else if (CurrentOutputSourceDetails->Type == EVENT_FORWARDING_FILE)
109  {
110  TempTypeString = "file ";
111  }
112  else if (CurrentOutputSourceDetails->Type == EVENT_FORWARDING_TCP)
113  {
114  TempTypeString = "tcp ";
115  }
116 
117  ShowMessages("%d %s %s\t%s\n", IndexToShowList, TempTypeString.c_str(), TempStateString.c_str(), CurrentOutputSourceDetails->Name);
118  }
119  }
120  else
121  {
122  ShowMessages("output forwarding list is empty.\n\n");
123  }
124 
125  return;
126  }
127 
128  if (SplittedCommand.size() <= 2)
129  {
130  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'output'\n\n");
131  CommandOutputHelp();
132  return;
133  }
134 
135  //
136  // Check if it's a create, open, or close
137  //
138  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("create"))
139  {
140  //
141  // It's a create
142  //
143 
144  //
145  // check if the parameters are okay for a create or not
146  //
147  if (SplittedCommand.size() <= 4)
148  {
149  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'output'\n\n");
150  CommandOutputHelp();
151  return;
152  }
153 
154  //
155  // Check for the type of the output source
156  //
157  if (!SplittedCommand.at(3).compare("file"))
158  {
159  Type = EVENT_FORWARDING_FILE;
160  }
161  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(3).compare("namedpipe"))
162  {
163  Type = EVENT_FORWARDING_NAMEDPIPE;
164  }
165  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(3).compare("tcp"))
166  {
167  Type = EVENT_FORWARDING_TCP;
168  }
169  else
170  {
171  ShowMessages("incorrect type near '%s'\n\n",
172  SplittedCommand.at(3).c_str());
173  CommandOutputHelp();
174  return;
175  }
176 
177  //
178  // Check to make sure that the name doesn't exceed the maximum character
179  //
180  if (SplittedCommand.at(2).size() >=
181  MAXIMUM_CHARACTERS_FOR_EVENT_FORWARDING_NAME)
182  {
183  ShowMessages("name of the output cannot exceed form %d.\n\n",
184  MAXIMUM_CHARACTERS_FOR_EVENT_FORWARDING_NAME);
185  CommandOutputHelp();
186  return;
187  }
188 
189  //
190  // Search to see if there is another output source with the
191  // same name which we don't want to create two or more output
192  // sources with the same name
193  //
194 
195  if (g_OutputSourcesInitialized)
196  {
197  TempList = &g_OutputSources;
198 
199  while (&g_OutputSources != TempList->Flink)
200  {
201  TempList = TempList->Flink;
202 
203  PDEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING CurrentOutputSourceDetails =
204  CONTAINING_RECORD(TempList, DEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING, OutputSourcesList);
205 
206  if (strcmp(CurrentOutputSourceDetails->Name,
207  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(2).c_str()) == 0)
208  {
209  //
210  // Indicate that we found this item
211  //
212  OutputSourceFound = TRUE;
213 
214  //
215  // No need to search through the list anymore
216  //
217  break;
218  }
219  }
220 
221  //
222  // Check whether the entered name already exists
223  //
224  if (OutputSourceFound)
225  {
226  ShowMessages("err, the name you entered, already exists, please choose "
227  "another name.\n\n");
228  return;
229  }
230  }
231 
232  //
233  // try to open the source and get the handle
234  //
235 
236  DetailsOfSource = Command.substr(Command.find(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(3)) +
237  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(3).size() + 1,
238  Command.size());
239 
240  SourceHandle = ForwardingCreateOutputSource(Type, DetailsOfSource, &Socket);
241 
242  //
243  // Check if it's a valid handle or not
244  //
245  if (SourceHandle == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
246  {
247  ShowMessages(
248  "err, invalid address or cannot open or find the address.\n\n");
249  return;
250  }
251 
252  //
253  // allocate the buffer for storing the event forwarding details
254  //
255  EventForwardingObject =
256  (PDEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING)malloc(sizeof(DEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING));
257 
258  if (EventForwardingObject == NULL)
259  {
260  ShowMessages("err, in allocating memory for event forwarding.\n\n");
261  return;
262  }
263 
264  RtlZeroMemory(EventForwardingObject, sizeof(DEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING));
265 
266  //
267  // Set the state
268  //
269  EventForwardingObject->State = EVENT_FORWARDING_STATE_NOT_OPENED;
270 
271  //
272  // Set the type
273  //
274  EventForwardingObject->Type = Type;
275 
276  //
277  // Get a new tag
278  //
279  EventForwardingObject->OutputUniqueTag = ForwardingGetNewOutputSourceTag();
280 
281  //
282  // Set the handle or in the case of TCP, set the socket
283  //
284  if (Type == EVENT_FORWARDING_TCP)
285  {
286  EventForwardingObject->Socket = Socket;
287  }
288  else
289  {
290  EventForwardingObject->Handle = SourceHandle;
291  }
292 
293  //
294  // Move the name of the output source to the buffer
295  //
296  strcpy_s(EventForwardingObject->Name, SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(2).c_str());
297 
298  //
299  // Check if list is initialized or not
300  //
301  if (!g_OutputSourcesInitialized)
302  {
303  g_OutputSourcesInitialized = TRUE;
304  InitializeListHead(&g_OutputSources);
305  }
306 
307  //
308  // Add the source to the trace list
309  //
310  InsertHeadList(&g_OutputSources,
311  &(EventForwardingObject->OutputSourcesList));
312  }
313  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("open"))
314  {
315  //
316  // It's an open
317  //
318  if (!g_OutputSourcesInitialized)
319  {
320  ShowMessages("err, the name you entered, not found.\n\n");
321  return;
322  }
323  //
324  // Now we should find the corresponding object in the memory and
325  // pass it to the global open functions
326  //
327  TempList = &g_OutputSources;
328 
329  while (&g_OutputSources != TempList->Flink)
330  {
331  TempList = TempList->Flink;
332 
333  PDEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING CurrentOutputSourceDetails = CONTAINING_RECORD(
334  TempList,
335  DEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING,
336  OutputSourcesList);
337 
338  if (strcmp(CurrentOutputSourceDetails->Name,
339  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(2).c_str()) == 0)
340  {
341  //
342  // Indicate that we found this item
343  //
344  OutputSourceFound = TRUE;
345 
346  //
347  // Open the output
348  //
349  Status = ForwardingOpenOutputSource(CurrentOutputSourceDetails);
350 
351  if (Status == DEBUGGER_OUTPUT_SOURCE_STATUS_ALREADY_CLOSED)
352  {
353  ShowMessages("err, the name you entered was already closed.\n\n");
354  return;
355  }
356  else if (Status == DEBUGGER_OUTPUT_SOURCE_STATUS_ALREADY_OPENED)
357  {
358  ShowMessages("err, the name you entered was already opened.\n\n");
359  return;
360  }
361  else if (Status !=
362  DEBUGGER_OUTPUT_SOURCE_STATUS_SUCCESSFULLY_OPENED)
363  {
364  ShowMessages("err, unable to open the output source.\n\n");
365  return;
366  }
367 
368  //
369  // No need to search through the list anymore
370  //
371  break;
372  }
373  }
374 
375  if (!OutputSourceFound)
376  {
377  ShowMessages("err, the name you entered, not found.\n\n");
378  return;
379  }
380  }
381  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("close"))
382  {
383  //
384  // It's a close
385  //
386  if (!g_OutputSourcesInitialized)
387  {
388  ShowMessages("err, the name you entered, not found.\n\n");
389  return;
390  }
391 
392  //
393  // Now we should find the corresponding object in the memory and
394  // pass it to the global close functions
395  //
396  TempList = &g_OutputSources;
397 
398  while (&g_OutputSources != TempList->Flink)
399  {
400  TempList = TempList->Flink;
401 
402  PDEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING CurrentOutputSourceDetails = CONTAINING_RECORD(
403  TempList,
404  DEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING,
405  OutputSourcesList);
406 
407  if (strcmp(CurrentOutputSourceDetails->Name,
408  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(2).c_str()) == 0)
409  {
410  //
411  // Indicate that we found this item
412  //
413  OutputSourceFound = TRUE;
414 
415  //
416  // Close the output if it's not already closed
417  //
418  Status = ForwardingCloseOutputSource(CurrentOutputSourceDetails);
419 
420  if (Status == DEBUGGER_OUTPUT_SOURCE_STATUS_ALREADY_CLOSED)
421  {
422  ShowMessages("err, the name you entered was already closed.\n\n");
423  return;
424  }
425  else if (Status == DEBUGGER_OUTPUT_SOURCE_STATUS_UNKNOWN_ERROR)
426  {
427  ShowMessages("err, unable to close the source.\n\n");
428  return;
429  }
430  else if (Status !=
431  DEBUGGER_OUTPUT_SOURCE_STATUS_SUCCESSFULLY_CLOSED)
432  {
433  ShowMessages("err, unable to close the source.\n\n");
434  return;
435  }
436 
437  //
438  // No need to search through the list anymore
439  //
440  break;
441  }
442  }
443 
444  if (!OutputSourceFound)
445  {
446  ShowMessages("err, the name you entered, not found.\n\n");
447  return;
448  }
449  }
450  else
451  {
452  //
453  // Invalid argument
454  //
455  ShowMessages("incorrect option at '%s'\n\n", SplittedCommand.at(1).c_str());
456  CommandOutputHelp();
457  return;
458  }
459 }
ForwardingCloseOutputSource
DEBUGGER_OUTPUT_SOURCE_STATUS ForwardingCloseOutputSource(PDEBUGGER_EVENT_FORWARDING SourceDescriptor)
Closes the output source.
Definition: forwarding.cpp:101
ForwardingOpenOutputSource

◆ CommandP()

VOID CommandP ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of p command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
45 {
46  UINT32 StepCount;
47  DEBUGGER_REMOTE_STEPPING_REQUEST RequestFormat;
48 
49  //
50  // Validate the commands
51  //
52  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1 && SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
53  {
54  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'p'\n\n");
55  CommandPHelp();
56  return;
57  }
58 
59  //
60  // Set type of request
61  //
62  RequestFormat = DEBUGGER_REMOTE_STEPPING_REQUEST_STEP_OVER;
63 
64  //
65  // Check if the command has a counter parameter
66  //
67  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
68  {
69  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(SplittedCommand.at(1), &StepCount))
70  {
71  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for [count]\n\n");
72  CommandPHelp();
73  return;
74  }
75  }
76  else
77  {
78  StepCount = 1;
79  }
80 
81  //
82  // Check if the remote serial debuggee is paused or not
83  //
84  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
85  {
86  for (size_t i = 0; i < StepCount; i++)
87  {
88  //
89  // For logging purpose
90  //
91  // ShowMessages("percentage : %f %% (%x)\n", 100.0 * (i /
92  // (float)StepCount), i);
93  //
94 
95  KdSendStepPacketToDebuggee(RequestFormat);
96 
97  if (!SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("pr"))
98  {
99  //
100  // Show registers
101  //
102  ShowAllRegisters();
103  if (i != StepCount - 1)
104  {
105  ShowMessages("\n");
106  }
107  }
108  }
109  }
110  else
111  {
112  ShowMessages("err, stepping (p) is not valid in the current context, you "
113  "should connect to a debuggee\n");
114  }
115 }
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)
Definition: globals.h:171
CommandPHelp
VOID CommandPHelp()
help of p command
Definition: p.cpp:25

◆ CommandPa2va()

VOID CommandPa2va ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!pa2va command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
44 {
45  BOOL Status;
46  ULONG ReturnedLength;
47  UINT64 TargetPa;
48  UINT32 Pid = 0;
49  DEBUGGER_VA2PA_AND_PA2VA_COMMANDS AddressDetails = {0};
50  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
51 
52  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1 || SplittedCommand.size() >= 5 ||
53  SplittedCommand.size() == 3)
54  {
55  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!pa2va'\n\n");
56  CommandPa2vaHelp();
57  return;
58  }
59 
60  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
61  {
62  //
63  // It's just a address for current process
64  //
65  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(1), &TargetPa))
66  {
67  //
68  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
69  //
70  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
71  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(1).c_str());
72  return;
73  }
74  }
75  else
76  {
77  //
78  // It might be address + pid
79  //
80  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("pid"))
81  {
82  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(SplittedCommand.at(2), &Pid))
83  {
84  ShowMessages("incorrect address, please enter a valid process id\n\n");
85  return;
86  }
87  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(3), &TargetPa))
88  {
89  //
90  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
91  //
92  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
93  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(3).c_str());
94  return;
95  }
96  }
97  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(2).compare("pid"))
98  {
99  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(1), &TargetPa))
100  {
101  //
102  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
103  //
104  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
105  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(1).c_str());
106 
107  return;
108  }
109  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(SplittedCommand.at(3), &Pid))
110  {
111  ShowMessages("incorrect address, please enter a valid process id\n\n");
112  return;
113  }
114  }
115  else
116  {
117  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!pa2va'\n\n");
118  CommandPa2vaHelp();
119  return;
120  }
121  }
122 
123  if (!g_DeviceHandle)
124  {
125  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
126  "use 'load' command?\n");
127  return;
128  }
129 
130  //
131  // Check to prevent using process id in !pa2va command
132  //
133  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee && Pid != 0)
134  {
135  ShowMessages("err, you cannot specify 'pid' in the debugger mode\n\n");
136  return;
137  }
138 
139  if (Pid == 0)
140  {
141  Pid = GetCurrentProcessId();
142  }
143 
144  //
145  // Prepare the buffer
146  // We use same buffer for input and output
147  //
148  AddressDetails.PhysicalAddress = TargetPa;
149  AddressDetails.ProcessId = Pid;
150  AddressDetails.IsVirtual2Physical = FALSE;
151 
152  //
153  // Send IOCTL
154  //
155  Status = DeviceIoControl(
156  g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
157  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_VA2PA_AND_PA2VA_COMMANDS, // IO Control code
158  &AddressDetails, // Input Buffer to driver.
159  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_VA2PA_AND_PA2VA_COMMANDS, // Input buffer length
160  &AddressDetails, // Output Buffer from driver.
161  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_VA2PA_AND_PA2VA_COMMANDS, // Length of output
162  // buffer in bytes.
163  &ReturnedLength, // Bytes placed in buffer.
164  NULL // synchronous call
165  );
166 
167  if (!Status)
168  {
169  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code 0x%x\n", GetLastError());
170  return;
171  }
172 
173  if (AddressDetails.KernelStatus == DEBUGEER_OPERATION_WAS_SUCCESSFULL)
174  {
175  //
176  // Show the results
177  //
178  ShowMessages("%llx\n", AddressDetails.VirtualAddress);
179  }
180  else
181  {
182  //
183  // An err occurred, no results
184  //
185  ShowErrorMessage(AddressDetails.KernelStatus);
186  }
187 }
CommandPa2vaHelp
VOID CommandPa2vaHelp()
help of !pa2va command
Definition: pa2va.cpp:25
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)
Definition: globals.h:171

65 {

◆ CommandPmc()

VOID CommandPmc ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!pmc command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
42 {
43  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
44  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
45  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
47  UINT32 EventLength;
48  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
49  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
50  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
51  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
52 
53  //
54  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
55  //
56  //
57  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
58  &SplittedCommand,
59  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
60  PMC_INSTRUCTION_EXECUTION,
61  &Event,
62  &EventLength,
63  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
64  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
65  &ActionCustomCode,
66  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
67  &ActionScript,
68  &ActionScriptLength))
69  {
70  CommandPmcHelp();
71  return;
72  }
73 
74  //
75  // Check for size
76  //
77  if (SplittedCommand.size() > 1)
78  {
79  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!pmc'\n");
80  CommandPmcHelp();
81  return;
82  }
83 
84  //
85  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
86  //
87  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
88  {
89  //
90  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
91  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
92  // already freed the Event and string buffers
93  //
94  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
95  {
96  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
97  }
98  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
99  {
100  free(ActionCustomCode);
101  }
102  if (ActionScript != NULL)
103  {
104  free(ActionScript);
105  }
106  return;
107  }
108 
109  //
110  // Add the event to the kernel
111  //
112  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
113  {
114  //
115  // There was an error
116  //
117  return;
118  }
119 }
CommandPmcHelp
VOID CommandPmcHelp()
help of !pmc command
Definition: pmc.cpp:20

◆ CommandPrint()

VOID CommandPrint ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of print command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
44 {
45  PVOID CodeBuffer;
46  UINT64 BufferAddress;
47  UINT32 BufferLength;
48  UINT32 Pointer;
49 
50  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
51  {
52  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'print'\n\n");
53  CommandPrintHelp();
54  return;
55  }
56 
57  //
58  // Trim the command
59  //
60  Trim(Command);
61 
62  //
63  // Remove print from it
64  //
65  Command.erase(0, 5);
66 
67  //
68  // Trim it again
69  //
70  Trim(Command);
71 
72  //
73  // Prepend and append 'print(' and ')'
74  //
75  Command.insert(0, "print(");
76  Command.append(");");
77 
78  //
79  // TODO: end of string must have a whitspace. fix it.
80  //
81  Command.append(" ");
82 
83  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
84  {
85  //
86  // Send over serial
87  //
88 
89  //
90  // Run script engine handler
91  //
92  CodeBuffer = ScriptEngineParseWrapper((char *)Command.c_str());
93 
94  if (CodeBuffer == NULL)
95  {
96  //
97  // return to show that this item contains an script
98  //
99  return;
100  }
101 
102  //
103  // Print symbols (test)
104  //
105  // PrintSymbolBufferWrapper(CodeBuffer);
106 
107  //
108  // Set the buffer and length
109  //
110  BufferAddress = ScriptEngineWrapperGetHead(CodeBuffer);
111  BufferLength = ScriptEngineWrapperGetSize(CodeBuffer);
112  Pointer = ScriptEngineWrapperGetPointer(CodeBuffer);
113 
114  //
115  // Send it to the remote debuggee
116  //
117  KdSendScriptPacketToDebuggee(BufferAddress, BufferLength, Pointer, FALSE);
118 
119  //
120  // Remove the buffer of script engine interpreted code
121  //
122  ScriptEngineWrapperRemoveSymbolBuffer(CodeBuffer);
123  }
124  else
125  {
126  //
127  // error
128  //
129  ShowMessages("err, you're not connected to any debuggee\n");
130  }
131 }

help of print command

◆ CommandProcess()

VOID CommandProcess ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

.process command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
42 {
43  UINT64 TargetProcess = 0;
44 
45  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 3 && SplittedCommand.size() != 1)
46  {
47  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.process'\n\n");
48  CommandProcessHelp();
49  return;
50  }
51 
52  //
53  // Check if it's connected to a remote debuggee or not
54  //
55  if (!g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
56  {
57  ShowMessages("err, you're not connected to any debuggee\n");
58  return;
59  }
60 
61  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
62  {
63  //
64  // Send the packet to get current process
65  //
66  KdSendSwitchProcessPacketToDebuggee(TRUE, NULL);
67  }
68  else if (SplittedCommand.size() == 3 &&
69  !SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("pid"))
70  {
71  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(SplittedCommand.at(2), &TargetProcess))
72  {
73  ShowMessages(
74  "please specify a correct hex value for the process that you "
75  "want to operate on it\n\n");
76  CommandProcessHelp();
77  return;
78  }
79 
80  //
81  // Send the packet to change process
82  //
83  KdSendSwitchProcessPacketToDebuggee(FALSE, TargetProcess);
84  }
85  else
86  {
87  ShowMessages("invalid parameter\n\n");
88  CommandProcessHelp();
89  return;
90  }
91 }
KdSendSwitchProcessPacketToDebuggee
BOOLEAN KdSendSwitchProcessPacketToDebuggee(BOOLEAN GetRemotePid, UINT32 NewPid)
Sends a change core or '.process pid x' command packet to the debuggee.

◆ CommandPte()

VOID CommandPte ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!pte command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
37 {
38  BOOL Status;
39  ULONG ReturnedLength;
40  UINT64 TargetVa;
41  DEBUGGER_READ_PAGE_TABLE_ENTRIES_DETAILS PteRead = {0};
42 
43  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
44  {
45  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!pte'\n\n");
46  CommandPteHelp();
47  return;
48  }
49 
50  //
51  // Trim the command
52  //
53  Trim(Command);
54 
55  //
56  // Remove !pte from it
57  //
58  Command.erase(0, 4);
59 
60  //
61  // Trim it again
62  //
63  Trim(Command);
64 
65  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(Command, &TargetVa))
66  {
67  //
68  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
69  //
70  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
71  Command.c_str());
72 
73  return;
74  }
75 
76  if (!g_DeviceHandle)
77  {
78  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
79  "use 'load' command?\n");
80  return;
81  }
82 
83  //
84  // Prepare the buffer
85  // We use same buffer for input and output
86  //
87  PteRead.VirtualAddress = TargetVa;
88 
89  //
90  // Send IOCTL
91  //
92  Status = DeviceIoControl(
93  g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
94  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_READ_PAGE_TABLE_ENTRIES_DETAILS, // IO Control code
95  &PteRead, // Input Buffer to driver.
96  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_READ_PAGE_TABLE_ENTRIES_DETAILS, // Input buffer length
97  &PteRead, // Output Buffer from driver.
98  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_READ_PAGE_TABLE_ENTRIES_DETAILS, // Length of output
99  // buffer in bytes.
100  &ReturnedLength, // Bytes placed in buffer.
101  NULL // synchronous call
102  );
103 
104  if (!Status)
105  {
106  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code 0x%x\n", GetLastError());
107  return;
108  }
109 
110  if (PteRead.KernelStatus != DEBUGEER_OPERATION_WAS_SUCCESSFULL)
111  {
112  ShowErrorMessage(PteRead.KernelStatus);
113  return;
114  }
115 
116  //
117  // Show the results
118  //
119  /*
120  VA fffff8003abc9370
121  PXE at FFFF83C1E0F07F80 PPE at FFFF83C1E0FF0000 PDE at
122  FFFF83C1FE000EA8 PTE at FFFF83FC001D5E48 contains 0000000004108063
123  contains 0000000004109063 contains 00000000026008E3 contains
124  0000000000000000 pfn 4108 ---DA--KWEV pfn 4109 ---DA--KWEV pfn
125  2600 --LDA--KWEV LARGE PAGE pfn 27c9
126  */
127  ShowMessages("VA %llx\n", TargetVa);
128  ShowMessages("PML4E (PXE) at %016llx\tcontains %016llx\nPDPT (PPE) at "
129  "%016llx\tcontains "
130  "%016llx\nPDE at %016llx\tcontains %016llx\n",
131  PteRead.Pml4eVirtualAddress,
132  PteRead.Pml4eValue,
133  PteRead.PdpteVirtualAddress,
134  PteRead.PdpteValue,
135  PteRead.PdeVirtualAddress,
136  PteRead.PdeValue);
137 
138  //
139  // Check if it's a large PDE
140  //
141  if (PteRead.PdeVirtualAddress == PteRead.PteVirtualAddress)
142  {
143  ShowMessages("PDE is a large page, so it doesn't have a PTE\n");
144  }
145  else
146  {
147  ShowMessages("PTE at %016llx\tcontains %016llx\n",
148  PteRead.PteVirtualAddress,
149  PteRead.PteValue);
150  }
151 }
CommandPteHelp
VOID CommandPteHelp()
help of !pte command
Definition: pte.cpp:20

◆ CommandR()

VOID CommandR ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of r command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
95 {
96  //
97  // Interpret here
98  //
99  PVOID CodeBuffer;
100  UINT64 BufferAddress;
101  UINT32 BufferLength;
102  UINT32 Pointer;
103  REGS_ENUM Reg;
104  vector<string> Tmp;
105 
106  string SetRegValue = "SetRegValue";
107 
108  if (SplittedCommand[0] != "r")
109  {
110  return;
111  }
112 
113  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
114  {
115  //
116  // show all registers
117  //
118  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
119  {
120  ShowAllRegisters();
121  }
122  else
123  {
124  ShowMessages("err, reading registers (r) is not valid in the current "
125  "context, you should connect to a debuggee\n");
126  }
127 
128  return;
129  }
130  //
131  // clear additional space of the command string
132  //
133 
134  //
135  // if command does not contain a '=' means user wants to read it
136  //
137  if (Command.find('=', 0) == string::npos)
138  {
139  Command.erase(0, 1);
140  PDEBUGGEE_REGISTER_READ_DESCRIPTION RegD =
141  new DEBUGGEE_REGISTER_READ_DESCRIPTION;
142  ReplaceAll(Command, "@", "");
143  ReplaceAll(Command, " ", "");
144  if (RegistersMap.find(Command) != RegistersMap.end())
145  {
146  Reg = RegistersMap[Command];
147  }
148  else
149  {
150  Reg = (REGS_ENUM)-1;
151  }
152  if (Reg != -1)
153  {
154  RegD->RegisterID = Reg;
155 
156  //
157  // send the request
158  //
159  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
160  {
161  KdSendReadRegisterPacketToDebuggee(RegD);
162  }
163  else
164  {
165  ShowMessages("err, reading registers (r) is not valid in the current "
166  "context, you should connect to a debuggee\n");
167  }
168  }
169  else
170  {
171  ShowMessages("err, register %s is invalid\n", Command.c_str());
172  }
173  delete (RegD);
174  }
175 
176  //
177  // if command contains a '=' means user wants modify the register
178  //
179 
180  else if (Command.find("=", 0))
181  {
182  PDEBUGGEE_REGISTER_READ_DESCRIPTION RegD =
183  new DEBUGGEE_REGISTER_READ_DESCRIPTION;
184  Command.erase(0, 1);
185  Tmp = Split(Command, '=');
186  if (Tmp.size() == 2)
187  {
188  ReplaceAll(Tmp[0], " ", "");
189  string tmp = Tmp[0];
190  if (RegistersMap.find(Tmp[0]) != RegistersMap.end())
191  {
192  Reg = RegistersMap[Tmp[0]];
193  }
194  else
195  {
196  ReplaceAll(tmp, "@", "");
197  if (RegistersMap.find(tmp) != RegistersMap.end())
198  {
199  Reg = RegistersMap[tmp];
200  }
201  else
202  {
203  Reg = (REGS_ENUM)-1;
204  }
205  }
206  if (Reg != -1)
207  {
208  RegD->RegisterID = Reg;
209 
210  //
211  // send the request
212  //
213 
214  SetRegValue = "@" + tmp + '=' + Tmp[1] + "; ";
215  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
216  {
217  //
218  // Send over serial
219  //
220 
221  //
222  // Run script engine handler
223  //
224  CodeBuffer = ScriptEngineParseWrapper((char *)SetRegValue.c_str());
225  if (CodeBuffer == NULL)
226  {
227  //
228  // return to show that this item contains an script
229  //
230  return;
231  }
232 
233  //
234  // Print symbols (test)
235  //
236  // PrintSymbolBufferWrapper(CodeBuffer);
237 
238  //
239  // Set the buffer and length
240  //
241  BufferAddress = ScriptEngineWrapperGetHead(CodeBuffer);
242  BufferLength = ScriptEngineWrapperGetSize(CodeBuffer);
243  Pointer = ScriptEngineWrapperGetPointer(CodeBuffer);
244 
245  //
246  // Send it to the remote debuggee
247  //
248  KdSendScriptPacketToDebuggee(BufferAddress, BufferLength, Pointer, FALSE);
249 
250  //
251  // Remove the buffer of script engine interpreted code
252  //
253  ScriptEngineWrapperRemoveSymbolBuffer(CodeBuffer);
254  }
255  else
256  {
257  //
258  // error
259  //
260  ShowMessages("err, you're not connected to any debuggee\n");
261  }
262  }
263  }
264  }
265 }
ReplaceAll
VOID ReplaceAll(string &str, const string &from, const string &to)
general replace all function
Definition: common.cpp:85
KdSendReadRegisterPacketToDebuggee
BOOLEAN KdSendReadRegisterPacketToDebuggee(PDEBUGGEE_REGISTER_READ_DESCRIPTION RegDes)
Send a Read register packet to the debuggee.
Definition: kd.cpp:327
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)
Definition: globals.h:171
RegistersMap
map< string, REGS_ENUM > RegistersMap
Definition: r.cpp:22
ShowAllRegisters
VOID ShowAllRegisters()
handler of r show all registers command
Definition: r.cpp:78

◆ CommandRdmsr()

VOID CommandRdmsr ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

rdmsr command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
38 {
39  BOOL Status;
40  BOOL IsNextCoreId = FALSE;
41  BOOL SetMsr = FALSE;
42  DEBUGGER_READ_AND_WRITE_ON_MSR MsrReadRequest;
43  ULONG ReturnedLength;
44  UINT64 Msr;
45  UINT32 CoreNumer = DEBUGGER_READ_AND_WRITE_ON_MSR_APPLY_ALL_CORES;
46  SYSTEM_INFO SysInfo;
47  DWORD NumCPU;
48 
49  if (SplittedCommand.size() >= 5)
50  {
51  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'rdmsr'\n\n");
52  CommandRdmsrHelp();
53  return;
54  }
55 
56  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
57  {
58  if (!Section.compare(SplittedCommand.at(0)))
59  {
60  continue;
61  }
62 
63  if (IsNextCoreId)
64  {
65  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(Section, &CoreNumer))
66  {
67  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for core id\n\n");
68  CommandRdmsrHelp();
69  return;
70  }
71  IsNextCoreId = FALSE;
72  continue;
73  }
74 
75  if (!Section.compare("core"))
76  {
77  IsNextCoreId = TRUE;
78  continue;
79  }
80 
81  if (SetMsr || !ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &Msr))
82  {
83  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value to be read\n\n");
84  CommandRdmsrHelp();
85  return;
86  }
87  SetMsr = TRUE;
88  }
89 
90  //
91  // Check if msr is set or not
92  //
93  if (!SetMsr)
94  {
95  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value to be read\n\n");
96  CommandRdmsrHelp();
97  return;
98  }
99  if (IsNextCoreId)
100  {
101  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for core\n\n");
102  CommandRdmsrHelp();
103  return;
104  }
105 
106  if (!g_DeviceHandle)
107  {
108  ShowMessages("handle of driver not, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
109  "use 'load' command?\n");
110  return;
111  }
112 
113  MsrReadRequest.ActionType = DEBUGGER_MSR_READ;
114  MsrReadRequest.Msr = Msr;
115  MsrReadRequest.CoreNumber = CoreNumer;
116 
117  //
118  // Find logical cores count
119  //
120  GetSystemInfo(&SysInfo);
121  NumCPU = SysInfo.dwNumberOfProcessors;
122 
123  //
124  // allocate buffer for transfering messages
125  //
126  UINT64 * OutputBuffer = (UINT64 *)malloc(sizeof(UINT64) * NumCPU);
127 
128  ZeroMemory(OutputBuffer, sizeof(UINT64) * NumCPU);
129 
130  Status = DeviceIoControl(
131  g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
132  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_READ_OR_WRITE_MSR, // IO Control code
133  &MsrReadRequest, // Input Buffer to driver.
134  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_READ_AND_WRITE_ON_MSR, // Input buffer length
135  OutputBuffer, // Output Buffer from driver.
136  sizeof(UINT64) * NumCPU, // Length of output buffer in bytes.
137  &ReturnedLength, // Bytes placed in buffer.
138  NULL // synchronous call
139  );
140 
141  if (!Status)
142  {
143  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code (0x%x), either msr index or core id is invalid\n",
144  GetLastError());
145  free(OutputBuffer);
146  return;
147  }
148 
149  //
150  // btw, %x is enough, no need to %llx
151  //
152  if (CoreNumer == DEBUGGER_READ_AND_WRITE_ON_MSR_APPLY_ALL_CORES)
153  {
154  //
155  // Show all cores
156  //
157  for (size_t i = 0; i < NumCPU; i++)
158  {
159  ShowMessages("core : 0x%x - msr[%llx] = %s\n", i, Msr, SeparateTo64BitValue((OutputBuffer[i])).c_str());
160  }
161  }
162  else
163  {
164  //
165  // Show for a single-core
166  //
167  ShowMessages("core : 0x%x - msr[%llx] = %s\n", CoreNumer, Msr, SeparateTo64BitValue((OutputBuffer[0])).c_str());
168  }
169 
170  //
171  // Free the buffer
172  //
173  free(OutputBuffer);
174 }
CommandRdmsrHelp
VOID CommandRdmsrHelp()
help of rdmsr command
Definition: rdmsr.cpp:20

◆ CommandReadMemoryAndDisassembler()

VOID CommandReadMemoryAndDisassembler ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

u* d* !u* !d* commands handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
57 {
58  UINT32 Pid = 0;
59  UINT32 Length = 0;
60  UINT64 TargetAddress = 0;
61  BOOLEAN IsNextProcessId = FALSE;
62  BOOLEAN IsFirstCommand = TRUE;
63  BOOLEAN IsNextLength = FALSE;
64  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
65  UINT32 IndexInCommandCaseSensitive = 0;
66 
67  string FirstCommand = SplittedCommand.front();
68 
69  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
70  {
71  //
72  // Means that user entered just a connect so we have to
73  // ask to connect to what ?
74  //
75  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '%s' command\n\n", FirstCommand.c_str());
76  CommandReadMemoryAndDisassemblerHelp();
77  return;
78  }
79 
80  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
81  {
82  IndexInCommandCaseSensitive++;
83 
84  if (IsFirstCommand)
85  {
86  IsFirstCommand = FALSE;
87  continue;
88  }
89  if (IsNextProcessId == TRUE)
90  {
91  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(Section, &Pid))
92  {
93  ShowMessages("err, you should enter a valid proc id\n\n");
94  return;
95  }
96  IsNextProcessId = FALSE;
97  continue;
98  }
99 
100  if (IsNextLength == TRUE)
101  {
102  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(Section, &Length))
103  {
104  ShowMessages("err, you should enter a valid length\n\n");
105  return;
106  }
107  IsNextLength = FALSE;
108  continue;
109  }
110 
111  if (!Section.compare("l"))
112  {
113  IsNextLength = TRUE;
114  continue;
115  }
116 
117  if (!Section.compare("pid"))
118  {
119  IsNextProcessId = TRUE;
120  continue;
121  }
122 
123  //
124  // Probably it's address
125  //
126  if (TargetAddress == 0)
127  {
128  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1),
129  &TargetAddress))
130  {
131  //
132  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
133  //
134  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n",
135  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1).c_str());
136  return;
137  }
138  }
139  else
140  {
141  //
142  // User inserts two address
143  //
144  ShowMessages("err, incorrect use of '%s' command\n\n",
145  FirstCommand.c_str());
146  CommandReadMemoryAndDisassemblerHelp();
147 
148  return;
149  }
150  }
151 
152  if (!TargetAddress)
153  {
154  //
155  // User inserts two address
156  //
157  ShowMessages("err, please enter a valid address\n\n");
158 
159  return;
160  }
161 
162  if (Length == 0)
163  {
164  //
165  // Default length (user doesn't specified)
166  //
167  if (!FirstCommand.compare("u") || !FirstCommand.compare("!u"))
168  {
169  Length = 0x40;
170  }
171  else
172  {
173  Length = 0x80;
174  }
175  }
176 
177  if (IsNextLength || IsNextProcessId)
178  {
179  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '%s' command\n\n", FirstCommand.c_str());
180  CommandReadMemoryAndDisassemblerHelp();
181  return;
182  }
183 
184  //
185  // Check to prevent using process id in d* and u* commands
186  //
187  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee && Pid != 0)
188  {
189  ShowMessages("err, you cannot specify 'pid' in the debugger mode\n\n");
190  return;
191  }
192 
193  if (Pid == 0)
194  {
195  //
196  // Default process we read from current process
197  //
198  Pid = GetCurrentProcessId();
199  }
200 
201  if (!FirstCommand.compare("db"))
202  {
203  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DB,
204  TargetAddress,
205  DEBUGGER_READ_VIRTUAL_ADDRESS,
206  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
207  Pid,
208  Length);
209  }
210  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("dc"))
211  {
212  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DC,
213  TargetAddress,
214  DEBUGGER_READ_VIRTUAL_ADDRESS,
215  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
216  Pid,
217  Length);
218  }
219  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("dd"))
220  {
221  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DD,
222  TargetAddress,
223  DEBUGGER_READ_VIRTUAL_ADDRESS,
224  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
225  Pid,
226  Length);
227  }
228  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("dq"))
229  {
230  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DQ,
231  TargetAddress,
232  DEBUGGER_READ_VIRTUAL_ADDRESS,
233  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
234  Pid,
235  Length);
236  }
237  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("!db"))
238  {
239  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DB,
240  TargetAddress,
241  DEBUGGER_READ_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS,
242  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
243  Pid,
244  Length);
245  }
246  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("!dc"))
247  {
248  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DC,
249  TargetAddress,
250  DEBUGGER_READ_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS,
251  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
252  Pid,
253  Length);
254  }
255  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("!dd"))
256  {
257  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DD,
258  TargetAddress,
259  DEBUGGER_READ_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS,
260  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
261  Pid,
262  Length);
263  }
264  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("!dq"))
265  {
266  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DQ,
267  TargetAddress,
268  DEBUGGER_READ_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS,
269  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
270  Pid,
271  Length);
272  }
273 
274  //
275  // Disassembler (!u or u or u2 !u2)
276  //
277  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("u"))
278  {
279  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(
280  DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DISASSEMBLE64,
281  TargetAddress,
282  DEBUGGER_READ_VIRTUAL_ADDRESS,
283  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
284  Pid,
285  Length);
286  }
287  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("!u"))
288  {
289  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(
290  DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DISASSEMBLE64,
291  TargetAddress,
292  DEBUGGER_READ_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS,
293  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
294  Pid,
295  Length);
296  }
297  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("u2"))
298  {
299  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(
300  DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DISASSEMBLE32,
301  TargetAddress,
302  DEBUGGER_READ_VIRTUAL_ADDRESS,
303  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
304  Pid,
305  Length);
306  }
307  else if (!FirstCommand.compare("!u2"))
308  {
309  HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(
310  DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DISASSEMBLE32,
311  TargetAddress,
312  DEBUGGER_READ_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS,
313  READ_FROM_KERNEL,
314  Pid,
315  Length);
316  }
317 }
HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble
VOID HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble(DEBUGGER_SHOW_MEMORY_STYLE Style, UINT64 Address, DEBUGGER_READ_MEMORY_TYPE MemoryType, DEBUGGER_READ_READING_TYPE ReadingType, UINT32 Pid, UINT Size)
Read memory and disassembler.

CommandReadMemoryAndDisassemblerHelp
VOID CommandReadMemoryAndDisassemblerHelp()
help of u* d* !u* !d* commands
Definition: d-u.cpp:25
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)

◆ CommandScript()

VOID CommandScript ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

.script command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
42 {
43  std::string Line;
44  BOOLEAN IsOpened = FALSE;
45  string NewPath;
46  int CommandExecutionResult = 0;
47 
48  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
49  {
50  ShowMessages("please specify a file\n");
51  CommandScriptHelp();
52  return;
53  }
54 
55  //
56  // Trim the command
57  //
58  Trim(Command);
59 
60  //
61  // Remove .script from it
62  //
63  Command.erase(0, 7);
64 
65  //
66  // Trim it again
67  //
68  Trim(Command);
69 
70  //
71  // Parse the script file
72  //
73  ifstream File(Command);
74 
75  if (File.is_open())
76  {
77  IsOpened = TRUE;
78 
79  //
80  // Indicate that it's a script
81  //
82  g_ExecutingScript = TRUE;
83 
84  while (std::getline(File, Line))
85  {
86  //
87  // Show current running command
88  //
89  HyperdbgShowSignature();
90  ShowMessages("%s\n", Line.c_str());
91 
92  CommandExecutionResult = HyperdbgInterpreter(Line.c_str());
93  ShowMessages("\n");
94 
95  //
96  // if the debugger encounters an exit state then the return will be 1
97  //
98  if (CommandExecutionResult == 1)
99  {
100  //
101  // Exit from the debugger
102  //
103  exit(0);
104  }
105  }
106 
107  //
108  // Indicate that script is finished
109  //
110  g_ExecutingScript = FALSE;
111 
112  File.close();
113  }
114 
115  if (!IsOpened)
116  {
117  ShowMessages("err, invalid file specified for .script command\n");
118  }
119 }
HyperdbgInterpreter
int HyperdbgInterpreter(const char *Command)
Interpret commands.
Definition: interpreter.cpp:44
HyperdbgShowSignature
VOID HyperdbgShowSignature()
Show signature of HyperDbg.
Definition: interpreter.cpp:214
CommandScriptHelp
VOID CommandScriptHelp()
help of .script command
Definition: script.cpp:27
g_ExecutingScript
BOOLEAN g_ExecutingScript
Shows whether the target is executing a script form '.script' command or executing script by an argum...
Definition: globals.h:380

◆ CommandSearchMemory()

VOID CommandSearchMemory ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!s* s* commands handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
56 {
57  BOOL Status;
58  BOOL SetAddress = FALSE;
59  BOOL SetValue = FALSE;
60  BOOL SetProcId = FALSE;
61  BOOL NextIsProcId = FALSE;
62  BOOL SetLength = FALSE;
63  BOOL NextIsLength = FALSE;
64  DEBUGGER_SEARCH_MEMORY SearchMemoryRequest = {0};
65  PUINT64 ResultsBuffer;
66  UINT64 CurrentValue;
67  UINT64 Address;
68  UINT64 Value = 0;
69  UINT64 Length = 0;
70  UINT32 ProcId = 0;
71  UINT32 CountOfValues = 0;
72  UINT32 FinalSize = 0;
73  UINT64 * FinalBuffer;
74  vector<UINT64> ValuesToEdit;
75  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
76  UINT32 IndexInCommandCaseSensitive = 0;
77 
78  if (SplittedCommand.size() <= 4)
79  {
80  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 's*'\n\n");
81  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
82  return;
83  }
84 
85  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
86  {
87  IndexInCommandCaseSensitive++;
88 
89  if (!Section.compare(SplittedCommand.at(0)))
90  {
91  if (!Section.compare("!sb"))
92  {
93  SearchMemoryRequest.MemoryType = SEARCH_PHYSICAL_MEMORY;
94  SearchMemoryRequest.ByteSize = SEARCH_BYTE;
95  }
96  else if (!Section.compare("!sd"))
97  {
98  SearchMemoryRequest.MemoryType = SEARCH_PHYSICAL_MEMORY;
99  SearchMemoryRequest.ByteSize = SEARCH_DWORD;
100  }
101  else if (!Section.compare("!sq"))
102  {
103  SearchMemoryRequest.MemoryType = SEARCH_PHYSICAL_MEMORY;
104  SearchMemoryRequest.ByteSize = SEARCH_QWORD;
105  }
106  else if (!Section.compare("sb"))
107  {
108  SearchMemoryRequest.MemoryType = SEARCH_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
109  SearchMemoryRequest.ByteSize = SEARCH_BYTE;
110  }
111  else if (!Section.compare("sd"))
112  {
113  SearchMemoryRequest.MemoryType = SEARCH_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
114  SearchMemoryRequest.ByteSize = SEARCH_DWORD;
115  }
116  else if (!Section.compare("sq"))
117  {
118  SearchMemoryRequest.MemoryType = SEARCH_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
119  SearchMemoryRequest.ByteSize = SEARCH_QWORD;
120  }
121  else
122  {
123  //
124  // What's this? :(
125  //
126  ShowMessages("unknown error happened !\n\n");
127  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
128  return;
129  }
130 
131  continue;
132  }
133 
134  if (NextIsProcId)
135  {
136  //
137  // It's a process id
138  //
139  NextIsProcId = FALSE;
140 
141  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(Section, &ProcId))
142  {
143  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex prcoess id\n\n");
144  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
145  return;
146  }
147  else
148  {
149  //
150  // Means that the proc id is set, next we should read value
151  //
152  continue;
153  }
154  }
155 
156  if (NextIsLength)
157  {
158  //
159  // It's a length
160  //
161  NextIsLength = FALSE;
162 
163  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &Length))
164  {
165  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex length\n\n");
166  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
167  return;
168  }
169  else
170  {
171  //
172  // Means that the proc id is set, next we should read value
173  //
174  SetLength = TRUE;
175  continue;
176  }
177  }
178 
179  //
180  // Check if it's a process id or not
181  //
182  if (!SetProcId && !Section.compare("pid"))
183  {
184  NextIsProcId = TRUE;
185  continue;
186  }
187 
188  //
189  // Check if it's a length or not
190  //
191  if (!SetLength && !Section.compare("l"))
192  {
193  NextIsLength = TRUE;
194  continue;
195  }
196 
197  if (!SetAddress)
198  {
199  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1), &Address))
200  {
201  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
202  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(IndexInCommandCaseSensitive - 1).c_str());
203  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
204  return;
205  }
206  else
207  {
208  //
209  // Means that the address is set, next we should read value
210  //
211  SetAddress = TRUE;
212  continue;
213  }
214  }
215 
216  if (SetAddress)
217  {
218  //
219  // Remove the hex notations
220  //
221  if (Section.rfind("0x", 0) == 0 || Section.rfind("0X", 0) == 0 ||
222  Section.rfind("\\x", 0) == 0 || Section.rfind("\\X", 0) == 0)
223  {
224  Section = Section.erase(0, 2);
225  }
226  else if (Section.rfind("x", 0) == 0 || Section.rfind("X", 0) == 0)
227  {
228  Section = Section.erase(0, 1);
229  }
230  Section.erase(remove(Section.begin(), Section.end(), '`'), Section.end());
231 
232  //
233  // Check if the value is valid based on byte counts
234  //
235  if (SearchMemoryRequest.ByteSize == SEARCH_BYTE && Section.size() >= 3)
236  {
237  ShowMessages("please specify a byte (hex) value for 'sb' or '!sb'\n\n");
238  return;
239  }
240  if (SearchMemoryRequest.ByteSize == SEARCH_DWORD && Section.size() >= 9)
241  {
242  ShowMessages(
243  "please specify a dword (hex) value for 'sd' or '!sd'\n\n");
244  return;
245  }
246  if (SearchMemoryRequest.ByteSize == SEARCH_QWORD &&
247  Section.size() >= 17)
248  {
249  ShowMessages(
250  "please specify a qword (hex) value for 'sq' or '!sq'\n\n");
251  return;
252  }
253 
254  //
255  // Qword is checked by the following function, no need to double
256  // check it above.
257  //
258  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &Value))
259  {
260  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value to search in the "
261  "memory content\n\n");
262  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
263  return;
264  }
265  else
266  {
267  //
268  // Add it to the list
269  //
270  ValuesToEdit.push_back(Value);
271 
272  //
273  // Keep track of values to modify
274  //
275  CountOfValues++;
276 
277  if (!SetValue)
278  {
279  //
280  // At least on walue is there
281  //
282  SetValue = TRUE;
283  }
284  continue;
285  }
286  }
287  }
288 
289  //
290  // Check to prevent using process id in s* commands
291  //
292  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee && ProcId != 0)
293  {
294  ShowMessages("err, you cannot specify 'pid' in the debugger mode\n\n");
295  return;
296  }
297 
298  if (ProcId == 0)
299  {
300  ProcId = GetCurrentProcessId();
301  }
302 
303  //
304  // Fill the structure
305  //
306  SearchMemoryRequest.ProcessId = ProcId;
307  SearchMemoryRequest.Address = Address;
308  SearchMemoryRequest.CountOf64Chunks = CountOfValues;
309 
310  //
311  // Check if address and value are set or not
312  //
313  if (!SetAddress)
314  {
315  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex address\n\n");
316  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
317  return;
318  }
319  if (!SetValue)
320  {
321  ShowMessages(
322  "please specify a correct hex value as the content to search\n\n");
323  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
324  return;
325  }
326  if (!SetLength)
327  {
328  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value as the length\n\n");
329  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
330  return;
331  }
332  if (NextIsProcId)
333  {
334  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value as the process id\n\n");
335  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
336  return;
337  }
338  if (NextIsLength)
339  {
340  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex length\n\n");
341  CommandSearchMemoryHelp();
342  return;
343  }
344 
345  if (!g_DeviceHandle)
346  {
347  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
348  "use 'load' command?\n");
349  return;
350  }
351 
352  //
353  // Now it's time to put everything together in one structure
354  //
355  FinalSize = (CountOfValues * sizeof(UINT64)) + SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_SEARCH_MEMORY;
356 
357  //
358  // Set the size
359  //
360  SearchMemoryRequest.FinalStructureSize = FinalSize;
361 
362  //
363  // Set the length
364  //
365  SearchMemoryRequest.Length = Length;
366 
367  //
368  // Allocate structure + buffer
369  //
370  FinalBuffer = (UINT64 *)malloc(FinalSize);
371 
372  if (!FinalBuffer)
373  {
374  ShowMessages("unable to allocate memory\n\n");
375  return;
376  }
377 
378  //
379  // Zero the buffer
380  //
381  ZeroMemory(FinalBuffer, FinalSize);
382 
383  //
384  // Copy the structure on top of the allocated buffer
385  //
386  memcpy(FinalBuffer, &SearchMemoryRequest, SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_SEARCH_MEMORY);
387 
388  //
389  // Put the values in 64 bit structures
390  //
391  std::copy(ValuesToEdit.begin(), ValuesToEdit.end(), (UINT64 *)((UINT64)FinalBuffer + SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_SEARCH_MEMORY));
392 
393  //
394  // Allocate a buffer to store the results
395  //
396  ResultsBuffer = (PUINT64)malloc(MaximumSearchResults * sizeof(UINT64));
397 
398  //
399  // Also it's better to Zero the memory; however it's not necessary
400  // as we zero the buffer in the search routines
401  //
402  ZeroMemory(ResultsBuffer, MaximumSearchResults * sizeof(UINT64));
403 
404  //
405  // Fire the IOCTL
406  //
407  Status =
408  DeviceIoControl(g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
409  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_SEARCH_MEMORY, // IO Control code
410  FinalBuffer, // Input Buffer to driver.
411  FinalSize, // Input buffer length
412  ResultsBuffer, // Output Buffer from driver.
413  MaximumSearchResults *
414  sizeof(UINT64), // Length of output buffer in bytes.
415  NULL, // Bytes placed in buffer.
416  NULL // synchronous call
417  );
418 
419  if (!Status)
420  {
421  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code 0x%x\n", GetLastError());
422  free(FinalBuffer);
423  return;
424  }
425 
426  //
427  // Show the results (if any)
428  //
429  for (size_t i = 0; i < MaximumSearchResults; i++)
430  {
431  CurrentValue = ResultsBuffer[i];
432 
433  if (CurrentValue == NULL)
434  {
435  //
436  // We ended up the buffer, nothing else to show,
437  // just check whether we found anything or not
438  //
439  if (i == 0)
440  {
441  ShowMessages("not found\n");
442  }
443  break;
444  }
445  ShowMessages("%llx\n", CurrentValue);
446  }
447 
448  //
449  // Free the buffers
450  //
451  free(FinalBuffer);
452  free(ResultsBuffer);
453 }
CommandSearchMemoryHelp
VOID CommandSearchMemoryHelp()
help of !s* s* commands
Definition: s.cpp:25
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)
Definition: globals.h:171

◆ CommandSettings()

VOID CommandSettings ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

settings command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
245 {
246  if (SplittedCommand.size() <= 1)
247  {
248  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'settings'\n\n");
249  CommandSettingsHelp();
250  return;
251  }
252 
253  //
254  // Interpret the field name
255  //
256  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("autounpause"))
257  {
258  //
259  // Handle it locally
260  //
261  CommandSettingsAutoUpause(SplittedCommand);
262  }
263  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("syntax"))
264  {
265  //
266  // If it's a remote debugger then we send it to the remote debugger
267  //
268  if (g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
269  {
270  RemoteConnectionSendCommand(Command.c_str(), strlen(Command.c_str()) + 1);
271  }
272  else
273  {
274  //
275  // If it's a connection over serial or a local debugging then
276  // we handle it locally
277  //
278  CommandSettingsSyntax(SplittedCommand);
279  }
280  }
281  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("autoflush"))
282  {
283  //
284  // If it's a remote debugger then we send it to the remote debugger
285  //
286  if (g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
287  {
288  RemoteConnectionSendCommand(Command.c_str(), strlen(Command.c_str()) + 1);
289  }
290  else
291  {
292  //
293  // If it's a connection over serial or a local debugging then
294  // we handle it locally
295  //
296  CommandSettingsAutoFlush(SplittedCommand);
297  }
298  }
299  else
300  {
301  //
302  // optionm not found
303  //
304  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'settings', please use 'help settings' "
305  "for more details\n");
306  return;
307  }
308 }

◆ CommandStatus()

VOID CommandStatus ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,

)

.status command handler

Command
Returns
VOID
52 {
53  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1)
54  {
55  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.status'\n\n");
56  CommandStatusHelp();
57  }
58 
59  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
60  {
61  //
62  // Connected to a remote debugger (serial port)
63  //
64  ShowMessages("remote debugging - debugger ('debugger mode')\n");
65  }
66  else if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
67  {
68  //
69  // Connected to a remote debuggee (serial port)
70  //
71  ShowMessages("remote debugging - debuggee ('debugger mode')\n");
72  }
73  else if (g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
74  {
75  //
76  // Connected to a remote debuggee
77  //
78  ShowMessages("remote debugging ('vmi mode'), ip : %s:%s \n",
79  g_ServerIp.c_str(),
80  g_ServerPort.c_str());
81  }
82  else if (g_IsConnectedToHyperDbgLocally)
83  {
84  //
85  // Connected to a local system
86  //
87  ShowMessages("local debugging ('vmi mode')\n");
88  }
89  else if (g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
90  {
91  //
92  // It's computer connect to a remote machine (this
93  // message shouldn't be showed)
94  //
95  ShowMessages("a remote debugger connected to this system in ('vmi "
96  "mode'), ip : %s:%s \n",
97  g_ServerIp.c_str(),
98  g_ServerPort.c_str());
99  }
100  else
101  {
102  //
103  // we never should see this message
104  //
105  ShowMessages("err, you're not connected to any instance of HyperDbg\n");
106  }
107 }

◆ CommandSym()

VOID CommandSym ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

.sym command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
42 {
43  UINT64 BaseAddress = NULL;
44  string Delimiter = "";
45  string PathToPdb = "";
46 
47  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
48  {
49  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.sym'\n\n");
50  CommandSymHelp();
51  return;
52  }
53 
54  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("table"))
55  {
56  //
57  // Validate params
58  //
59  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
60  {
61  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.sym'\n\n");
62  CommandSymHelp();
63  return;
64  }
65 
66  //
67  // Build and show symbol table
68  //
69  SymbolBuildAndShowSymbolTable();
70  }
71  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("reload") || !SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("download"))
72  {
73  //
74  // Validate params
75  //
76  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
77  {
78  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.sym'\n\n");
79  CommandSymHelp();
80  return;
81  }
82 
83  //
84  // Load and download available symbols
85  //
86  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("reload"))
87  {
88  SymbolReloadOrDownloadSymbols(FALSE, FALSE);
89  }
90  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("download"))
91  {
92  SymbolReloadOrDownloadSymbols(TRUE, FALSE);
93  }
94 
95  ShowMessages("symbol table successfully updated\n");
96  }
97  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("unload"))
98  {
99  //
100  // Validate params
101  //
102  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
103  {
104  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.sym'\n\n");
105  CommandSymHelp();
106  return;
107  }
108 
109  //
110  // unload without any parameters, means that unload
111  // all the symbols
112  //
113  ScriptEngineUnloadAllSymbolsWrapper();
114 
115  //
116  // Size is 3 there is module name (mot working ! I don't know why)
117  //
118  // ScriptEngineUnloadModuleSymbolWrapper((char *)SplittedCommand.at(2).c_str());
119  }
120  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("load"))
121  {
122  //
123  // Validate params
124  //
125  if (SplittedCommand.size() < 6)
126  {
127  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.sym'\n\n");
128  CommandSymHelp();
129  return;
130  }
131 
132  if (!SplittedCommand.at(2).compare("base"))
133  {
134  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(SplittedCommand.at(3), &BaseAddress))
135  {
136  ShowMessages("please add a valid hex address to be used as the base address\n\n");
137  CommandSymHelp();
138  return;
139  }
140 
141  //
142  // Base address is now valid, check if next parameter is path
143  //
144  if (SplittedCommand.at(4).compare("path"))
145  {
146  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.sym'\n\n");
147  CommandSymHelp();
148  return;
149  }
150 
151  //
152  // The rest of command is pdb path
153  //
154  Delimiter = "path ";
155  PathToPdb = Command.substr(Command.find(Delimiter) + 5, Command.size());
156 
157  //
158  // Check if pdb file exists or not
159  //
160  if (!IsFileExistA(PathToPdb.c_str()))
161  {
162  ShowMessages("pdb file not found\n");
163  return;
164  }
165 
166  ShowMessages("loading module symbol at '%s'\n", PathToPdb.c_str());
167 
168  //
169  // Load the pdb file (the validation of pdb file is checked into pdb
170  // parsing functions)
171  //
172  ScriptEngineLoadFileSymbolWrapper(BaseAddress, PathToPdb.c_str());
173  }
174  else
175  {
176  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '.sym'\n\n");
177  CommandSymHelp();
178  return;
179  }
180  }
181  else
182  {
183  ShowMessages("unknown parameter at '%s'\n\n", SplittedCommand.at(1).c_str());
184  CommandSymHelp();
185  return;
186  }
187 }
IsFileExistA
BOOLEAN IsFileExistA(const char *FileName)
check if a file exist or not (ASCII)
Definition: common.cpp:497
ScriptEngineUnloadAllSymbolsWrapper
UINT32 ScriptEngineUnloadAllSymbolsWrapper()
ScriptEngineUnloadAllSymbols wrapper.
Definition: script-engine-wrapper.cpp:65
ScriptEngineLoadFileSymbolWrapper
UINT32 ScriptEngineLoadFileSymbolWrapper(UINT64 BaseAddress, const char *PdbFileName)
ScriptEngineLoadFileSymbol wrapper.
Definition: script-engine-wrapper.cpp:54

VOID CommandSymHelp()
help of .sym command

BOOLEAN SymbolReloadOrDownloadSymbols(BOOLEAN IsDownload, BOOLEAN SilentLoad)
Reload or download symbols.
