◆ CommandSympath()

VOID CommandSympath ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

.sympath command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
42 {
43  inipp::Ini<char> Ini;
44  inipp::Ini<char> Ini2;
45  string SymbolServer = "";
46  WCHAR ConfigPath[MAX_PATH] = {0};
47  string Delimiter = "*";
48  string Token;
49 
50  //
51  // Get config file path
52  //
53  GetConfigFilePath(ConfigPath);
54 
55  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
56  {
57  ifstream Is(ConfigPath);
58 
59  //
60  // Show the current symbol path
61  //
62 
63  //
64  // Read config file
65  //
66  Ini.parse(Is);
67 
68  //
69  // Show config file
70  //
71  // Ini.generate(std::cout);
72 
73  inipp::get_value(Ini.sections["DEFAULT"], "SymbolServer", SymbolServer);
74 
75  Is.close();
76 
77  ShowMessages("current SymbolServer is : %s\n", SymbolServer.c_str());
78  }
79  else
80  {
81  //
82  // Save the symbol path
83  //
84 
85  //
86  // Trim the command
87  //
88  Trim(Command);
89 
90  //
91  // Remove .sympath from it
92  //
93  Command.erase(0, 8);
94 
95  //
96  // Trim it again
97  //
98  Trim(Command);
99 
100  //
101  // *** validate the symbols ***
102  //
103 
104  //
105  // Check if the string contains '*'
106  //
107  if (Command.find('*') != std::string::npos)
108  {
109  //
110  // Found
111  //
112  Token = Command.substr(0, Command.find(Delimiter));
113  // using transform() function and ::tolower in STL
114  transform(Token.begin(), Token.end(), Token.begin(), ::tolower);
115 
116  //
117  // Check if it starts with srv
118  //
119  if (!Token.compare("srv"))
120  {
121  ifstream Is(ConfigPath);
122 
123  //
124  // Show the current symbol path
125  //
126 
127  //
128  // Read config file
129  //
130  Ini.parse(Is);
131 
132  Is.close();
133 
134  //
135  // Save the config
136  //
137  Ini.sections["DEFAULT"]["SymbolServer"] = Command.c_str();
138  Ini.interpolate();
139 
140  //
141  // Test, show the config
142  //
143  // Ini.generate(std::cout);
144 
145  //
146  // Save the config
147  //
148  ofstream Os(ConfigPath);
149 
150  Ini.generate(Os);
151 
152  Os.close();
153 
154  //
155  // Show the message
156  //
157  ShowMessages("symbol server/path is configured successfully\n");
158  ShowMessages("use '.sym reload' or '.sym download' to load pdb files\n");
159  }
160  else
161  {
162  ShowMessages("symbol path is invalid\n\n");
163  CommandSympathHelp();
164  return;
165  }
166  }
167  else
168  {
169  ShowMessages("symbol path is invalid\n\n");
170  CommandSympathHelp();
171  return;
172  }
173  }
174 }
inipp::Ini
Definition: inipp.h:171
inipp::Ini::sections
Sections sections
Definition: inipp.h:177
inipp::Ini::generate
void generate(std::basic_ostream< CharT > &os) const
Definition: inipp.h:188
inipp::Ini::parse
void parse(std::basic_istream< CharT > &is)
Definition: inipp.h:201
inipp::Ini::interpolate
void interpolate()
Definition: inipp.h:245
GetConfigFilePath
VOID GetConfigFilePath(PWCHAR ConfigPath)
Get config path.
Definition: common.cpp:522
inipp::get_value
bool get_value(const std::map< std::basic_string< CharT >, std::basic_string< CharT >> &sec, const std::basic_string< CharT > &key, T &dst)
Definition: inipp.h:115
CommandSympathHelp
VOID CommandSympathHelp()
help of .sympath command
Definition: sympath.cpp:24

◆ CommandSyscallAndSysret()

VOID CommandSyscallAndSysret ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!syscall, !syscall2 and !sysret, !sysret2 commands handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
74 {
75  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
76  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
77  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
78  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
79  UINT32 EventLength;
80  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
81  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
82  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
83  UINT64 SpecialTarget = DEBUGGER_EVENT_SYSCALL_ALL_SYSRET_OR_SYSCALLS;
84  BOOLEAN GetSyscallNumber = FALSE;
85  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
86 
87  //
88  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
89  //
90  //
91  if (!SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!syscall") || !SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!syscall2"))
92  {
93  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
94  &SplittedCommand,
95  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
96  SYSCALL_HOOK_EFER_SYSCALL,
97  &Event,
98  &EventLength,
99  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
100  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
101  &ActionCustomCode,
102  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
103  &ActionScript,
104  &ActionScriptLength))
105  {
106  CommandSyscallHelp();
107  return;
108  }
109  }
110  else
111  {
112  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
113  &SplittedCommand,
114  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
115  SYSCALL_HOOK_EFER_SYSRET,
116  &Event,
117  &EventLength,
118  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
119  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
120  &ActionCustomCode,
121  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
122  &ActionScript,
123  &ActionScriptLength))
124  {
125  CommandSysretHelp();
126  return;
127  }
128  }
129 
130  //
131  // Interpret command specific details (if any)
132  //
133 
134  //
135  // Currently we do not support any extra argument for !sysret command
136  // it is because we don't know how to find syscall number in sysret
137  // and we don't wanna deal with dynamic mapping of rcx (user stack)
138  // in vmx-root
139  //
140  if (!SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!syscall") || !SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!syscall2"))
141  {
142  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
143  {
144  if (!Section.compare("!syscall") ||
145  !Section.compare("!syscall2") ||
146  !Section.compare("!sysret") ||
147  !Section.compare("!sysret2"))
148  {
149  continue;
150  }
151 
152  else if (!GetSyscallNumber)
153  {
154  //
155  // It's probably a syscall address
156  //
157  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &SpecialTarget))
158  {
159  //
160  // Unkonwn parameter
161  //
162  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
163 
164  if (!SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!syscall") || !SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!syscall2"))
165  {
166  CommandSyscallHelp();
167  }
168  else
169  {
170  CommandSysretHelp();
171  }
172  return;
173  }
174  else
175  {
176  GetSyscallNumber = TRUE;
177  }
178  }
179  else
180  {
181  //
182  // Unkonwn parameter
183  //
184  ShowMessages("unknown parameter '%s'\n\n", Section.c_str());
185 
186  if (!SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!syscall") || !SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!syscall2"))
187  {
188  CommandSyscallHelp();
189  }
190  else
191  {
192  CommandSysretHelp();
193  }
194  return;
195  }
196  }
197 
198  //
199  // Set the target syscall
200  //
201  Event->OptionalParam1 = SpecialTarget;
202  }
203 
204  //
205  // Set whether it's !syscall or !syscall2 or !sysret or !sysret2
206  //
207  if (!SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!syscall2") || !SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("!sysret2"))
208  {
209  //
210  // It's a !syscall2 or !sysret2
211  //
212  Event->OptionalParam2 = DEBUGGER_EVENT_SYSCALL_SYSRET_HANDLE_ALL_UD;
213  }
214  else
215  {
216  //
217  // It's a !syscall or !sysret
218  //
219  Event->OptionalParam2 = DEBUGGER_EVENT_SYSCALL_SYSRET_SAFE_ACCESS_MEMORY;
220  }
221 
222  //
223  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
224  //
225  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
226  {
227  //
228  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
229  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
230  // already freed the Event and string buffers
231  //
232  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
233  {
234  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
235  }
236  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
237  {
238  free(ActionCustomCode);
239  }
240  if (ActionScript != NULL)
241  {
242  free(ActionScript);
243  }
244  return;
245  }
246 
247  //
248  // Add the event to the kernel
249  //
250  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
251  {
252  //
253  // There was an error
254  //
255  return;
256  }
257 }
CommandSysretHelp
VOID CommandSysretHelp()
help of !sysret command
Definition: syscall-sysret.cpp:46
CommandSyscallHelp
VOID CommandSyscallHelp()
help of !syscall command
Definition: syscall-sysret.cpp:20

◆ CommandT()

VOID CommandT ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of t command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
45 {
46  UINT32 StepCount;
47  DEBUGGER_REMOTE_STEPPING_REQUEST RequestFormat;
48 
49  //
50  // Validate the commands
51  //
52  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1 && SplittedCommand.size() != 2)
53  {
54  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 't'\n\n");
55  CommandTHelp();
56  return;
57  }
58 
59  //
60  // Set type of step
61  //
62  RequestFormat = DEBUGGER_REMOTE_STEPPING_REQUEST_STEP_IN;
63 
64  //
65  // Check if the command has a counter parameter
66  //
67  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
68  {
69  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(SplittedCommand.at(1), &StepCount))
70  {
71  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for [count]\n\n");
72  CommandTHelp();
73  return;
74  }
75  }
76  else
77  {
78  StepCount = 1;
79  }
80 
81  //
82  // Check if the remote serial debuggee is paused or not
83  //
84  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
85  {
86  for (size_t i = 0; i < StepCount; i++)
87  {
88  KdSendStepPacketToDebuggee(RequestFormat);
89 
90  if (!SplittedCommand.at(0).compare("tr"))
91  {
92  //
93  // Show registers
94  //
95  ShowAllRegisters();
96  if (i != StepCount - 1)
97  {
98  ShowMessages("\n");
99  }
100  }
101  }
102  }
103  else
104  {
105  ShowMessages("err, stepping (t) is not valid in the current context, you "
106  "should connect to a debuggee\n");
107  }
108 }

◆ CommandTest()

VOID CommandTest ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

test command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
206 {
207  BOOL Status;
208  ULONG ReturnedLength;
209  PDEBUGGEE_KERNEL_AND_USER_TEST_INFORMATION
210  KernelSideTestInformationRequestArray;
211 
212  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 1)
213  {
214  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'test'\n\n");
215  CommandTestHelp();
216  return;
217  }
218 
219  else if (!g_DeviceHandle)
220  {
221  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
222  "use 'load' command?\n");
223  return;
224  }
225 
226  //
227  // *** Read kernel-side debugging information ***
228  //
229  KernelSideTestInformationRequestArray = (DEBUGGEE_KERNEL_AND_USER_TEST_INFORMATION *)malloc(TEST_CASE_MAXIMUM_BUFFERS_TO_COMMUNICATE);
230 
231  RtlZeroMemory(KernelSideTestInformationRequestArray, TEST_CASE_MAXIMUM_BUFFERS_TO_COMMUNICATE);
232 
233  //
234  // Send Ioctl to the kernel
235  //
236  Status = DeviceIoControl(
237  g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
238  IOCTL_SEND_GET_KERNEL_SIDE_TEST_INFORMATION, // IO Control code
239  KernelSideTestInformationRequestArray, // Input Buffer to driver.
240  SIZEOF_DEBUGGEE_KERNEL_AND_USER_TEST_INFORMATION, // Input buffer
241  // length
242  KernelSideTestInformationRequestArray, // Output Buffer from driver.
243  TEST_CASE_MAXIMUM_BUFFERS_TO_COMMUNICATE, // Length
244  // of
245  // output
246  // buffer
247  // in
248  // bytes.
249  &ReturnedLength, // Bytes placed in buffer.
250  NULL // synchronous call
251  );
252 
253  if (!Status)
254  {
255  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code 0x%x\n", GetLastError());
256  return;
257  }
258 
259  //
260  // Means to check just one command
261  //
262  if (CommandTestPerformTest(KernelSideTestInformationRequestArray, ReturnedLength))
263  {
264  ShowMessages("all the tests were successful :)\n");
265  }
266  else
267  {
268  ShowMessages("all or at least one of the tests failed :(\n");
269  }
270 
271  //
272  // Free the kernel-side buffer
273  //
274  free(KernelSideTestInformationRequestArray);
275 }

BOOLEAN CommandTestPerformTest(PDEBUGGEE_KERNEL_AND_USER_TEST_INFORMATION KernelSideInformation, UINT32 KernelSideInformationSize)
perform test on the remote process

◆ CommandTsc()

VOID CommandTsc ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

handler of !tsc command

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
42 {
43  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_EVENT_DETAIL Event = NULL;
44  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionBreakToDebugger = NULL;
45  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionCustomCode = NULL;
46  PDEBUGGER_GENERAL_ACTION ActionScript = NULL;
47  UINT32 EventLength;
48  UINT32 ActionBreakToDebuggerLength = 0;
49  UINT32 ActionCustomCodeLength = 0;
50  UINT32 ActionScriptLength = 0;
51  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
52 
53  //
54  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
55  //
56  //
57  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
58  &SplittedCommand,
59  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,
60  TSC_INSTRUCTION_EXECUTION,
61  &Event,
62  &EventLength,
63  &ActionBreakToDebugger,
64  &ActionBreakToDebuggerLength,
65  &ActionCustomCode,
66  &ActionCustomCodeLength,
67  &ActionScript,
68  &ActionScriptLength))
69  {
70  CommandTscHelp();
71  return;
72  }
73

75  // Check for size
76  //
77  if (SplittedCommand.size() > 1)
78  {
79  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!tsc'\n");
80  CommandTscHelp();
81  return;
82  }
83 
84  //
85  // Send the ioctl to the kernel for event registeration
86  //
87  if (!SendEventToKernel(Event, EventLength))
88  {
89  //
90  // There was an error, probably the handle was not initialized
91  // we have to free the Action before exit, it is because, we
92  // already freed the Event and string buffers
93  //
94  if (ActionBreakToDebugger != NULL)
95  {
96  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
97  }
98  if (ActionCustomCode != NULL)
99  {
100  free(ActionCustomCode);
101  }
102  if (ActionScript != NULL)
103  {
104  free(ActionScript);
105  }

108

110  // Add the event to the kernel
111  //
112  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
113  {
114  //
115  // There was an error
116  //
117  return;
118  }
119 }

◆ CommandUnhide()

VOID CommandUnhide ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!unhide command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
36 {
37  BOOLEAN Status;
38  ULONG ReturnedLength;
39  DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE UnhideRequest = {0};
40 
41  if (SplittedCommand.size() >= 2)
42  {
43  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!unhide'\n\n");
44  CommandUnhideHelp();
45  return;
46  }
47 
48  //
49  // Check if debugger is loaded or not
50  //
51  if (!g_DeviceHandle)
52  {
53  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
54  "use 'load' command?\n");
55  return;
56  }
57 
58  //
59  // We don't wanna hide the debugger and make transparent vm-exits
60  //
61  UnhideRequest.IsHide = FALSE;
62 
63  //
64  // Send the request to the kernel
65  //
66  Status = DeviceIoControl(
67  g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
68  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_UNHIDE_TO_TRANSPARENT_THE_DEBUGGER, // IO Control
69  // code
70  &UnhideRequest, // Input Buffer to driver.
71  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE, // Input buffer length
72  &UnhideRequest, // Output Buffer from driver.
73  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_HIDE_AND_TRANSPARENT_DEBUGGER_MODE, // Length of output
74  // buffer in bytes.
75  &ReturnedLength, // Bytes placed in buffer.
76  NULL // synchronous call
77  );
78 
79  if (!Status)
80  {
81  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code 0x%x\n", GetLastError());
82  return;
83  }
84 
85  if (UnhideRequest.KernelStatus == DEBUGEER_OPERATION_WAS_SUCCESSFULL)
86  {
87  ShowMessages("transparent debugging successfully disabled :)\n");
88  }
89  else if (UnhideRequest.KernelStatus ==
90  DEBUGEER_ERROR_DEBUGGER_ALREADY_UHIDE)
91  {
92  ShowMessages("debugger is not in transparent-mode\n");
93  }
94  else
95  {
96  ShowMessages("unknown error occurred :(\n");
97  }
98 }

help of !unhide command

◆ CommandUnload()

VOID CommandUnload ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

unload command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
46 {
47  if (SplittedCommand.size() != 2 && SplittedCommand.size() != 3)
48  {
49  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'unload'\n\n");
50  CommandUnloadHelp();
51  return;
52  }
53 
54  //
55  // Check for the module
56  //
57  if ((SplittedCommand.size() == 2 && !SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("vmm")) ||
58  (SplittedCommand.size() == 3 && !SplittedCommand.at(2).compare("vmm") && !SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("remove")))
59  {
60  if (!g_IsConnectedToHyperDbgLocally)
61  {
62  ShowMessages("you're not connected to any instance of HyperDbg, did you "
63  "use '.connect'? \n");
64  return;
65  }
66 
67  //
68  // Check to avoid using this command in debugger-mode
69  //
70  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee || g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
71  {
72  ShowMessages("you're connected to a an instance of HyperDbg, please use "
73  "'.debug close' command\n");
74  return;
75  }
76 
77  if (g_IsDebuggerModulesLoaded)
78  {
79  HyperdbgUnload();
80 
81  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("remove"))
82  {
83  //
84  // Stop the driver
85  //
86  if (HyperdbgStopDriver())
87  {
88  ShowMessages("failed to stop driver\n");
89  }
90 
91  //
92  // Uninstall the driver
93  //
94  if (HyperdbgUninstallDriver())
95  {
96  ShowMessages("failed to uninstall the driver\n");
97  }
98  }
99  }
100  else
101  {
102  ShowMessages("there is nothing to unload\n");
103  }
104  }
105  else
106  {
107  //
108  // Module not found
109  //
110  ShowMessages("module not found, currently 'vmm' is the only available "
111  "module for HyperDbg\n");
112  }
113 }

◆ CommandVa2pa()

VOID CommandVa2pa ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

!va2pa command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
44 {
45  BOOL Status;
46  ULONG ReturnedLength;
47  UINT64 TargetVa;
48  UINT32 Pid = 0;
49  DEBUGGER_VA2PA_AND_PA2VA_COMMANDS AddressDetails = {0};
50  vector<string> SplittedCommandCaseSensitive {Split(Command, ' ')};
51 
52  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1 || SplittedCommand.size() >= 5 ||
53  SplittedCommand.size() == 3)
54  {
55  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!va2pa'\n\n");
56  CommandVa2paHelp();
57  return;
58  }
59 
60  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 2)
61  {
62  //
63  // It's just an address for current process
64  //
65  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(1), &TargetVa))
66  {
67  //
68  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
69  //
70  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
71  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(1).c_str());
72  return;
73  }
74  }
75  else
76  {
77  //
78  // It might be address + pid
79  //
80  if (!SplittedCommand.at(1).compare("pid"))
81  {
82  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(SplittedCommand.at(2), &Pid))
83  {
84  ShowMessages("incorrect address, please enter a valid process id\n\n");
85  return;
86  }
87 
88  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(3), &TargetVa))
89  {
90  //
91  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
92  //
93  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
94  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(3).c_str());
95  return;
96  }
97  }
98  else if (!SplittedCommand.at(2).compare("pid"))
99  {
100  if (!SymbolConvertNameToAddress(SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(1), &TargetVa))
101  {
102  //
103  // Couldn't resolve or unkonwn parameter
104  //
105  ShowMessages("err, couldn't resolve error at '%s'\n\n",
106  SplittedCommandCaseSensitive.at(1).c_str());
107  return;
108  }
109 
110  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(SplittedCommand.at(3), &Pid))
111  {
112  ShowMessages("incorrect address, please enter a valid process id\n\n");
113  return;
114  }
115  }
116  else
117  {
118  ShowMessages("incorrect use of '!va2pa'\n\n");
119  CommandVa2paHelp();
120  return;
121  }
122  }
123 
124  if (!g_DeviceHandle)
125  {
126  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
127  "use 'load' command?\n");
128  return;
129  }
130 
131  //
132  // Check to prevent using process id in !va2pa command
133  //
134  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee && Pid != 0)
135  {
136  ShowMessages("err, you cannot specify 'pid' in the debugger mode\n\n");
137  return;
138  }
139 
140  if (Pid == 0)
141  {
142  Pid = GetCurrentProcessId();
143  }
144 
145  //
146  // Prepare the buffer
147  // We use same buffer for input and output
148  //
149  AddressDetails.VirtualAddress = TargetVa;
150  AddressDetails.ProcessId = Pid;
151  AddressDetails.IsVirtual2Physical = TRUE;
152 
153  //
154  // Send IOCTL
155  //
156  Status = DeviceIoControl(
157  g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
158  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_VA2PA_AND_PA2VA_COMMANDS, // IO Control code
159  &AddressDetails, // Input Buffer to driver.
160  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_VA2PA_AND_PA2VA_COMMANDS, // Input buffer length
161  &AddressDetails, // Output Buffer from driver.
162  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_VA2PA_AND_PA2VA_COMMANDS, // Length of output
163  // buffer in bytes.
164  &ReturnedLength, // Bytes placed in buffer.
165  NULL // synchronous call
166  );
167 
168  if (!Status)
169  {
170  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code 0x%x\n", GetLastError());
171  return;
172  }
173 
174  if (AddressDetails.KernelStatus == DEBUGEER_OPERATION_WAS_SUCCESSFULL)
175  {
176  //
177  // Show the results
178  //
179  ShowMessages("%llx\n", AddressDetails.PhysicalAddress);
180  }
181  else
182  {
183  //
184  // An err occurred, no results
185  //
186  ShowErrorMessage(AddressDetails.KernelStatus);
187  }
188 }
g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debuggee over (A remote guest)
Definition: globals.h:171
CommandVa2paHelp
VOID CommandVa2paHelp()
help of !va2pa command
Definition: va2pa.cpp:25

54  // Interpret and fill the general event and action fields
55  //
56  //
57  if (!InterpretGeneralEventAndActionsFields(
58  &SplittedCommand,
59  &SplittedCommandCaseSensitive,

61  &Event,

92  // already freed the Event and string buffers
93  //

95  {
96  free(ActionBreakToDebugger);
97  }

100  free(ActionCustomCode);

103  {
104  free(ActionScript);
105  }
106  return;
107  }

110  // Add the event to the kernel
111  //
112  if (!RegisterActionToEvent(ActionBreakToDebugger, ActionBreakToDebuggerLength, ActionCustomCode, ActionCustomCodeLength, ActionScript, ActionScriptLength))
113  {
114  //
115  // There was an error
116  //
117  return;
118  }
119 }

◆ CommandWrmsr()

VOID CommandWrmsr ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

wrmsr command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
38 {
39  BOOL Status;
40  BOOL IsNextCoreId = FALSE;
41  BOOL SetMsr = FALSE;
42  BOOL SetValue = FALSE;
43  DEBUGGER_READ_AND_WRITE_ON_MSR MsrWriteRequest;
44  UINT64 Msr;
45  UINT64 Value = 0;
46  UINT32 CoreNumer = DEBUGGER_READ_AND_WRITE_ON_MSR_APPLY_ALL_CORES;
47 
48  if (SplittedCommand.size() >= 6)
49  {
50  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'wrmsr'\n\n");
51  CommandWrmsrHelp();
52  return;
53  }
54 
55  for (auto Section : SplittedCommand)
56  {
57  if (!Section.compare(SplittedCommand.at(0)))
58  {
59  continue;
60  }
61 
62  if (IsNextCoreId)
63  {
64  if (!ConvertStringToUInt32(Section, &CoreNumer))
65  {
66  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for core id\n\n");
67  CommandWrmsrHelp();
68  return;
69  }
70  IsNextCoreId = FALSE;
71  continue;
72  }
73 
74  if (!Section.compare("core"))
75  {
76  IsNextCoreId = TRUE;
77  continue;
78  }
79 
80  if (!SetMsr)
81  {
82  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &Msr))
83  {
84  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value to be read\n\n");
85  CommandWrmsrHelp();
86  return;
87  }
88  else
89  {
90  //
91  // Means that the MSR is set, next we should read value
92  //
93  SetMsr = TRUE;
94  continue;
95  }
96  }
97 
98  if (SetMsr)
99  {
100  if (!ConvertStringToUInt64(Section, &Value))
101  {
102  ShowMessages(
103  "please specify a correct hex value to put on the msr\n\n");
104  CommandWrmsrHelp();
105  return;
106  }
107  else
108  {
109  SetValue = TRUE;
110  continue;
111  }
112  }
113  }
114 
115  //
116  // Check if msr is set or not
117  //
118  if (!SetMsr)
119  {
120  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value to write\n\n");
121  CommandWrmsrHelp();
122  return;
123  }
124  if (!SetValue)
125  {
126  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value to put on msr\n\n");
127  CommandWrmsrHelp();
128  return;
129  }
130  if (IsNextCoreId)
131  {
132  ShowMessages("please specify a correct hex value for core\n\n");
133  CommandWrmsrHelp();
134  return;
135  }
136 
137  if (!g_DeviceHandle)
138  {
139  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
140  "use 'load' command?\n");
141  return;
142  }
143 
144  MsrWriteRequest.ActionType = DEBUGGER_MSR_WRITE;
145  MsrWriteRequest.Msr = Msr;
146  MsrWriteRequest.CoreNumber = CoreNumer;
147  MsrWriteRequest.Value = Value;
148 
149  Status = DeviceIoControl(
150  g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
151  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_READ_OR_WRITE_MSR, // IO Control code
152  &MsrWriteRequest, // Input Buffer to driver.
153  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_READ_AND_WRITE_ON_MSR, // Input buffer length
154  NULL, // Output Buffer from driver.
155  NULL, // Length of output buffer in bytes.
156  NULL, // Bytes placed in buffer.
157  NULL // synchronous call
158  );
159 
160  if (!Status)
161  {
162  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code (0x%x), either msr index or core id is invalid\n",
163  GetLastError());
164  return;
165  }
166 
167  ShowMessages("\n");
168 }
CommandWrmsrHelp
VOID CommandWrmsrHelp()
help of wrmsr command
Definition: wrmsr.cpp:20

◆ CommandX()

VOID CommandX ( vector< string >  SplittedCommand,
string  Command 
)

x command handler

Parameters
SplittedCommand
Command
Returns
VOID
38 {
39  if (SplittedCommand.size() == 1)
40  {
41  ShowMessages("incorrect use of 'x'\n\n");
42  CommandXHelp();
43  return;
44  }
45 
46  //
47  // Trim the command
48  //
49  Trim(Command);
50 
51  //
52  // Remove x from it
53  //
54  Command.erase(0, 1);
55 
56  //
57  // Trim it again
58  //
59  Trim(Command);
60 
61  //
62  // Search for mask
63  //
64  ScriptEngineSearchSymbolForMaskWrapper(Command.c_str());
65 }
ScriptEngineSearchSymbolForMaskWrapper
UINT32 ScriptEngineSearchSymbolForMaskWrapper(const char *SearchMask)
ScriptEngineSearchSymbolForMask wrapper.
Definition: script-engine-wrapper.cpp:90

VOID CommandXHelp()
help of x command
Definition: x.cpp:20

◆ HyperDbgCheckWhetherTheCurrentInstructionIsCall()

BOOLEAN HyperDbgCheckWhetherTheCurrentInstructionIsCall ( unsigned char *  BufferToDisassemble,
UINT64  BuffLength,
BOOLEAN  Isx86_64,
PUINT32  CallLength 
)

Check whether the current instructio is a 'call' or not.

Parameters
BufferToDisassembleCurrent Bytes of assembly
BuffLengthLength of buffer
Isx86_64Whether it's an x86 or x64
Lengthof call (if return value is TRUE)
Returns
BOOLEAN
726 {
727  ZydisDecoder decoder;
728  ZydisFormatter formatter;
729  UINT64 CurrentRip = 0;
730  int instr_decoded = 0;
731  ZydisDecodedInstruction instruction;
732  char buffer[256];
733  UINT32 MaximumInstrDecoded = 1;
734 
735  //
736  // Default length
737  //
738  *CallLength = 0;
739 
740  if (ZydisGetVersion() != ZYDIS_VERSION)
741  {
742  ShowMessages("invalid zydis version\n");
743  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_ERROR;
744  }
745 
746  if (Isx86_64)
747  {
748  ZydisDecoderInit(&decoder, ZYDIS_MACHINE_MODE_LONG_64, ZYDIS_ADDRESS_WIDTH_64);
749  }
750  else
751  {
752  ZydisDecoderInit(&decoder, ZYDIS_MACHINE_MODE_LONG_COMPAT_32, ZYDIS_ADDRESS_WIDTH_32);
753  }
754 
755  ZydisFormatterInit(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_STYLE_INTEL);
756 
757  ZydisFormatterSetProperty(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_PROP_FORCE_SEGMENT, ZYAN_TRUE);
758  ZydisFormatterSetProperty(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_PROP_FORCE_SIZE, ZYAN_TRUE);
759 
760  //
761  // Replace the `ZYDIS_FORMATTER_FUNC_PRINT_ADDRESS_ABS` function that
762  // formats the absolute addresses
763  //
764  default_print_address_absolute =
765  (ZydisFormatterFunc)&ZydisFormatterPrintAddressAbsolute;
766  ZydisFormatterSetHook(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_FUNC_PRINT_ADDRESS_ABS, (const void **)&default_print_address_absolute);
767 
768  while (ZYAN_SUCCESS(ZydisDecoderDecodeBuffer(&decoder, BufferToDisassemble, BuffLength, &instruction)))
769  {
770  //
771  // We have to pass a `runtime_address` different to
772  // `ZYDIS_RUNTIME_ADDRESS_NONE` to enable printing of absolute addresses
773  //
774 
775  ZydisFormatterFormatInstruction(&formatter, &instruction, &buffer[0], sizeof(buffer), (ZyanU64)CurrentRip);
776 
777  if (instruction.mnemonic == ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_CALL)
778  {
779  //
780  // It's a call
781  //
782 
783  //
784  // Log call
785  //
786  // ShowMessages("call length : %d\n", instruction.length);
787 
788  //
789  // Set the length
790  //
791  *CallLength = instruction.length;
792 
793  return TRUE;
794  }
795  else
796  {
797  //
798  // It's not call
799  //
800  return FALSE;
801  }
802  }
803 }
default_print_address_absolute
ZydisFormatterFunc default_print_address_absolute
Definition: disassembler.cpp:69

◆ HyperDbgDisassembler32()

int HyperDbgDisassembler32 ( unsigned char *  BufferToDisassemble,
UINT64  BaseAddress,
UINT64  Size,
UINT32  MaximumInstrDecoded,
BOOLEAN  ShowBranchIsTakenOrNot,
PRFLAGS  Rflags 
)

Disassemble 32 bit assemblies.

Parameters
BufferToDisassemblebuffer to disassemble
BaseAddressthe base address of assembly
Sizesize of buffer
MaximumInstrDecodedmaximum instructions to decode, 0 means all possible
ShowBranchIsTakenOrNoton conditional jumps shows whether jumps is taken or not
Rflagsin the case ShowBranchIsTakenOrNot is true, we use this variable to show the result of jump
Returns
int
352 {
353  if (ZydisGetVersion() != ZYDIS_VERSION)
354  {
355  fputs("Invalid zydis version\n", ZYAN_STDERR);
356  return EXIT_FAILURE;
357  }
358 
359  ZydisDecoder decoder;
360  ZydisDecoderInit(&decoder, ZYDIS_MACHINE_MODE_LONG_COMPAT_32, ZYDIS_ADDRESS_WIDTH_32);
361 
362  DisassembleBuffer(&decoder, (UINT32)BaseAddress, &BufferToDisassemble[0], Size, MaximumInstrDecoded, FALSE, ShowBranchIsTakenOrNot, Rflags);
363 
364  return 0;
365 }
DisassembleBuffer
VOID DisassembleBuffer(ZydisDecoder *decoder, ZyanU64 runtime_address, ZyanU8 *data, ZyanUSize length, uint32_t maximum_instr, BOOLEAN is_x86_64, BOOLEAN show_of_branch_is_taken, PRFLAGS rflags)
Disassemble a user-mode buffer.

int HyperDbgDisassembler64 ( unsigned char *  BufferToDisassemble,

PRFLAGS  Rflags 
)

Disassemble x64 assemblies.

Parameters
BufferToDisassemblebuffer to disassemble
BaseAddressthe base address of assembly
Sizesize of buffer
MaximumInstrDecodedmaximum instructions to decode, 0 means all possible
ShowBranchIsTakenOrNoton conditional jumps shows whether jumps is taken or not
Rflagsin the case ShowBranchIsTakenOrNot is true, we use this variable to show the result of jump

int
315 {
316  if (ZydisGetVersion() != ZYDIS_VERSION)
317  {
318  fputs("Invalid zydis version\n", ZYAN_STDERR);
319  return EXIT_FAILURE;
320  }
321 
322  ZydisDecoder decoder;
323  ZydisDecoderInit(&decoder, ZYDIS_MACHINE_MODE_LONG_64, ZYDIS_ADDRESS_WIDTH_64);
324 
325  DisassembleBuffer(&decoder, BaseAddress, &BufferToDisassemble[0], Size, MaximumInstrDecoded, TRUE, ShowBranchIsTakenOrNot, Rflags);
326 
327  return 0;

◆ HyperDbgIsConditionalJumpTaken()

DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS HyperDbgIsConditionalJumpTaken ( unsigned char *  BufferToDisassemble,
UINT64  BuffLength,
RFLAGS  Rflags,
BOOLEAN  Isx86_64 
)

Check whether the jump is taken or not taken (in debugger)

the implementation of this function derived from the table in this site : http://www.unixwiz.net/techtips/x86-jumps.html

Parameters
BufferToDisassembleCurrent Bytes of assembly
BuffLengthLength of buffer
RflagsThe kernel's currnet RFLAG
Isx86_64Whether it's an x86 or x64
Returns
DEBUGGER_NEXT_INSTRUCTION_FINDER_STATUS
384 {
385  ZydisDecoder decoder;
386  ZydisFormatter formatter;
387  UINT64 CurrentRip = 0;
388  int instr_decoded = 0;
389  ZydisDecodedInstruction instruction;
390  char buffer[256];
391  UINT32 MaximumInstrDecoded = 1;
392 
393  if (ZydisGetVersion() != ZYDIS_VERSION)
394  {
395  ShowMessages("invalid zydis version\n");
396  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_ERROR;
397  }
398 
399  if (Isx86_64)
400  {
401  ZydisDecoderInit(&decoder, ZYDIS_MACHINE_MODE_LONG_64, ZYDIS_ADDRESS_WIDTH_64);
402  }
403  else
404  {
405  ZydisDecoderInit(&decoder, ZYDIS_MACHINE_MODE_LONG_COMPAT_32, ZYDIS_ADDRESS_WIDTH_32);
406  }
407 
408  ZydisFormatterInit(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_STYLE_INTEL);
409 
410  ZydisFormatterSetProperty(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_PROP_FORCE_SEGMENT, ZYAN_TRUE);
411  ZydisFormatterSetProperty(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_PROP_FORCE_SIZE, ZYAN_TRUE);
412 
413  //
414  // Replace the `ZYDIS_FORMATTER_FUNC_PRINT_ADDRESS_ABS` function that
415  // formats the absolute addresses
416  //
417  default_print_address_absolute =
418  (ZydisFormatterFunc)&ZydisFormatterPrintAddressAbsolute;
419  ZydisFormatterSetHook(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_FUNC_PRINT_ADDRESS_ABS, (const void **)&default_print_address_absolute);
420 
421  while (ZYAN_SUCCESS(ZydisDecoderDecodeBuffer(&decoder, BufferToDisassemble, BuffLength, &instruction)))
422  {
423  //
424  // We have to pass a `runtime_address` different to
425  // `ZYDIS_RUNTIME_ADDRESS_NONE` to enable printing of absolute addresses
426  //
427 
428  ZydisFormatterFormatInstruction(&formatter, &instruction, &buffer[0], sizeof(buffer), (ZyanU64)CurrentRip);
429 
430  switch (instruction.mnemonic)
431  {
432  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JO:
433 
434  //
435  // Jump if overflow (jo)
436  //
437  if (Rflags.OverflowFlag)
438  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
439  else
440  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
441 
442  break;
443 
444  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JNO:
445 
446  //
447  // Jump if not overflow (jno)
448  //
449  if (!Rflags.OverflowFlag)
450  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
451  else
452  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
453 
454  break;
455 
456  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JS:
457 
458  //
459  // Jump if sign
460  //
461  if (Rflags.SignFlag)
462  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
463  else
464  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
465 
466  break;
467 
468  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JNS:
469 
470  //
471  // Jump if not sign
472  //
473  if (!Rflags.SignFlag)
474  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
475  else
476  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
477 
478  break;
479 
480  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JZ:
481 
482  //
483  // Jump if equal (je),
484  // Jump if zero (jz)
485  //
486  if (Rflags.ZeroFlag)
487  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
488  else
489  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
490 
491  break;
492 
493  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JNZ:
494 
495  //
496  // Jump if not equal (jne),
497  // Jump if not zero (jnz)
498  //
499  if (!Rflags.ZeroFlag)
500  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
501  else
502  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
503 
504  break;
505 
506  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JB:
507 
508  //
509  // Jump if below (jb),
510  // Jump if not above or equal (jnae),
511  // Jump if carry (jc)
512  //
513 
514  //
515  // This jump is unsigned
516  //
517 
518  if (Rflags.CarryFlag)
519  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
520  else
521  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
522 
523  break;
524 
525  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JNB:
526 
527  //
528  // Jump if not below (jnb),
529  // Jump if above or equal (jae),
530  // Jump if not carry (jnc)
531  //
532 
533  //
534  // This jump is unsigned
535  //
536 
537  if (!Rflags.CarryFlag)
538  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
539  else
540  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
541 
542  break;
543 
544  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JBE:
545 
546  //
547  // Jump if below or equal (jbe),
548  // Jump if not above (jna)
549  //
550 
551  //
552  // This jump is unsigned
553  //
554 
555  if (Rflags.CarryFlag || Rflags.ZeroFlag)
556  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
557  else
558  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
559 
560  break;
561 
562  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JNBE:
563 
564  //
565  // Jump if above (ja),
566  // Jump if not below or equal (jnbe)
567  //
568 
569  //
570  // This jump is unsigned
571  //
572 
573  if (!Rflags.CarryFlag && !Rflags.ZeroFlag)
574  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
575  else
576  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
577 
578  break;
579 
580  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JL:
581 
582  //
583  // Jump if less (jl),
584  // Jump if not greater or equal (jnge)
585  //
586 
587  //
588  // This jump is signed
589  //
590 
591  if (Rflags.SignFlag != Rflags.OverflowFlag)
592  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
593  else
594  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
595 
596  break;
597 
598  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JNL:
599 
600  //
601  // Jump if greater or equal (jge),
602  // Jump if not less (jnl)
603  //
604 
605  //
606  // This jump is signed
607  //
608 
609  if (Rflags.SignFlag == Rflags.OverflowFlag)
610  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
611  else
612  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
613 
614  break;
615 
616  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JLE:
617 
618  //
619  // Jump if less or equal (jle),
620  // Jump if not greater (jng)
621  //
622 
623  //
624  // This jump is signed
625  //
626 
627  if (Rflags.ZeroFlag || Rflags.SignFlag != Rflags.OverflowFlag)
628  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
629  else
630  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
631 
632  break;
633 
634  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JNLE:
635 
636  //
637  // Jump if greater (jg),
638  // Jump if not less or equal (jnle)
639  //
640 
641  //
642  // This jump is signed
643  //
644 
645  if (!Rflags.ZeroFlag && Rflags.SignFlag == Rflags.OverflowFlag)
646  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
647  else
648  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
649 
650  break;
651 
652  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JP:
653 
654  //
655  // Jump if parity (jp),
656  // Jump if parity even (jpe)
657  //
658 
659  if (Rflags.ParityFlag)
660  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
661  else
662  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
663 
664  break;
665 
666  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JNP:
667 
668  //
669  // Jump if not parity (jnp),
670  // Jump if parity odd (jpo)
671  //
672 
673  if (!Rflags.ParityFlag)
674  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_TAKEN;
675  else
676  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_JUMP_IS_NOT_TAKEN;
677 
678  break;
679 
680  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JCXZ:
681  case ZydisMnemonic::ZYDIS_MNEMONIC_JECXZ:
682 
683  //
684  // Jump if %CX register is 0 (jcxz),
685  // Jump if% ECX register is 0 (jecxz)
686  //
687 
688  //
689  // Actually this instruction are rarely used
690  // but if we want to suport these instructions then we
691  // should read ecx and cx each time in the debuggee,
692  // so it's better to just ignore it as a non-conditional
693  // jump
694  //
695  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_NOT_CONDITIONAL_JUMP;
696 
697  default:
698 
699  //
700  // It's not a jump
701  //
702  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_NOT_CONDITIONAL_JUMP;
703  break;
704  }
705 
706  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_ERROR;
707  }
708 }

◆ HyperDbgLengthDisassemblerEngine()

UINT32 HyperDbgLengthDisassemblerEngine ( unsigned char *  BufferToDisassemble,
UINT64  BuffLength,
BOOLEAN  Isx86_64 
)

Length Disassbler engine based on Zydis.

Parameters
BufferToDisassembleCurrent Bytes of assembly
BuffLengthLength of buffer
Isx86_64Whether it's an x86 or x64
Lengthof call (if return value is TRUE)
Returns
UINT32
820 {
821  ZydisDecoder decoder;
822  ZydisFormatter formatter;
823  UINT64 CurrentRip = 0;
824  int instr_decoded = 0;
825  ZydisDecodedInstruction instruction;
826  char buffer[256];
827  UINT32 MaximumInstrDecoded = 1;
828 
829  if (ZydisGetVersion() != ZYDIS_VERSION)
830  {
831  ShowMessages("invalid zydis version\n");
832  return DEBUGGER_CONDITIONAL_JUMP_STATUS_ERROR;
833  }
834 
835  if (Isx86_64)
836  {
837  ZydisDecoderInit(&decoder, ZYDIS_MACHINE_MODE_LONG_64, ZYDIS_ADDRESS_WIDTH_64);
838  }
839  else
840  {
841  ZydisDecoderInit(&decoder, ZYDIS_MACHINE_MODE_LONG_COMPAT_32, ZYDIS_ADDRESS_WIDTH_32);
842  }
843 
844  ZydisFormatterInit(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_STYLE_INTEL);
845 
846  ZydisFormatterSetProperty(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_PROP_FORCE_SEGMENT, ZYAN_TRUE);
847  ZydisFormatterSetProperty(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_PROP_FORCE_SIZE, ZYAN_TRUE);
848 
849  //
850  // Replace the `ZYDIS_FORMATTER_FUNC_PRINT_ADDRESS_ABS` function that
851  // formats the absolute addresses
852  //
853  default_print_address_absolute =
854  (ZydisFormatterFunc)&ZydisFormatterPrintAddressAbsolute;
855  ZydisFormatterSetHook(&formatter, ZYDIS_FORMATTER_FUNC_PRINT_ADDRESS_ABS, (const void **)&default_print_address_absolute);
856 
857  while (ZYAN_SUCCESS(ZydisDecoderDecodeBuffer(&decoder, BufferToDisassemble, BuffLength, &instruction)))
858  {
859  //
860  // We have to pass a `runtime_address` different to
861  // `ZYDIS_RUNTIME_ADDRESS_NONE` to enable printing of absolute addresses
862  //
863  ZydisFormatterFormatInstruction(&formatter, &instruction, &buffer[0], sizeof(buffer), (ZyanU64)CurrentRip);
864 
865  //
866  // Return len of buffer
867  //
868  return instruction.length;
869  }
870 
871  //
872  // Error in disassembling buffer
873  //
874  return 0;
875 }

◆ HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble()

VOID HyperDbgReadMemoryAndDisassemble ( DEBUGGER_SHOW_MEMORY_STYLE  Style,
UINT64  Address,
DEBUGGER_READ_MEMORY_TYPE  MemoryType,
DEBUGGER_READ_READING_TYPE  ReadingType,
UINT32  Pid,
UINT  Size 
)

Read memory and disassembler.

Parameters
Stylestyle of show memory (as byte, dwrod, qword)
Addresslocation of where to read the memory
MemoryTypetype of memory (phyical or virtual)
ReadingTyperead from kernel or vmx-root
PidThe target process id
Sizesize of memory to read
34 {
35  BOOL Status;
36  ULONG ReturnedLength;
37  DEBUGGER_READ_MEMORY ReadMem = {0};
38  UINT32 OperationCode;
39  CHAR Character;
40 
41  ReadMem.Address = Address;
42  ReadMem.Pid = Pid;
43  ReadMem.Size = Size;
44  ReadMem.MemoryType = MemoryType;
45  ReadMem.ReadingType = ReadingType;
46  ReadMem.Style = Style;
47 
48  //
49  // send the request
50  //
51  if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebuggee)
52  {
53  KdSendReadMemoryPacketToDebuggee(&ReadMem);
54  return;
55  }
56  else if (!g_DeviceHandle)
57  {
58  ShowMessages("handle of the driver not found, probably the driver is not loaded. Did you "
59  "use 'load' command?\n");
60  return;
61  }
62 
63  //
64  // allocate buffer for transfering messages
65  //
66  unsigned char * OutputBuffer = (unsigned char *)malloc(Size);
67 
68  ZeroMemory(OutputBuffer, Size);
69 
70  Status = DeviceIoControl(g_DeviceHandle, // Handle to device
71  IOCTL_DEBUGGER_READ_MEMORY, // IO Control code
72  &ReadMem, // Input Buffer to driver.
73  SIZEOF_DEBUGGER_READ_MEMORY, // Input buffer length
74  OutputBuffer, // Output Buffer from driver.
75  Size, // Length of output buffer in bytes.
76  &ReturnedLength, // Bytes placed in buffer.
77  NULL // synchronous call
78  );
79 
80  if (!Status)
81  {
82  ShowMessages("ioctl failed with code 0x%x\n", GetLastError());
83  free(OutputBuffer);
84  return;
85  }
86 
87  if (Style == DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DB)
88  {
89  ShowMemoryCommandDB(OutputBuffer, Size, Address, MemoryType, ReturnedLength);
90  }
91  else if (Style == DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DC)
92  {
93  ShowMemoryCommandDC(OutputBuffer, Size, Address, MemoryType, ReturnedLength);
94  }
95  else if (Style == DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DD)
96  {
97  ShowMemoryCommandDD(OutputBuffer, Size, Address, MemoryType, ReturnedLength);
98  }
99  else if (Style == DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DQ)
100  {
101  ShowMemoryCommandDQ(OutputBuffer, Size, Address, MemoryType, ReturnedLength);
102  }
103  else if (Style == DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DISASSEMBLE64)
104  {
105  HyperDbgDisassembler64(OutputBuffer, Address, ReturnedLength, 0, FALSE, NULL);
106  }
107  else if (Style == DEBUGGER_SHOW_COMMAND_DISASSEMBLE32)
108  {
109  HyperDbgDisassembler32(OutputBuffer, Address, ReturnedLength, 0, FALSE, NULL);
110  }
111 
112  //
113  // free the buffer
114  //
115  free(OutputBuffer);
116 
117  ShowMessages("\n");
118 }
HyperDbgDisassembler32
int HyperDbgDisassembler32(unsigned char *BufferToDisassemble, UINT64 BaseAddress, UINT64 Size, UINT32 MaximumInstrDecoded, BOOLEAN ShowBranchIsTakenOrNot, PRFLAGS Rflags)
Disassemble 32 bit assemblies.
Definition: disassembler.cpp:346
HyperDbgDisassembler64
int HyperDbgDisassembler64(unsigned char *BufferToDisassemble, UINT64 BaseAddress, UINT64 Size, UINT32 MaximumInstrDecoded, BOOLEAN ShowBranchIsTakenOrNot, PRFLAGS Rflags)
Disassemble x64 assemblies.
Definition: disassembler.cpp:309

BOOLEAN KdSendReadMemoryPacketToDebuggee(PDEBUGGER_READ_MEMORY ReadMem)
Send a Read memory packet to the debuggee.
Definition: kd.cpp:362

Show memory in bytes (DB)
Definition: readmem.cpp:130

◆ ReadCpuDetails()

int ReadCpuDetails ( )
253 {
254  auto & outstream = std::cout;
255 
256  auto support_message = [&outstream](std::string isa_feature,
257  bool is_supported) {
258  ShowMessages("%s %s\n", isa_feature.c_str(), (is_supported ? "supported" : "not supported"));
259  };
260 
261  ShowMessages("\nvendor : %s\n", InstructionSet::Vendor().c_str());
262  ShowMessages("brand : %s\n\n", InstructionSet::Brand().c_str());
263 
264  support_message("3DNOW", InstructionSet::_3DNOW());
265  support_message("3DNOWEXT", InstructionSet::_3DNOWEXT());
266  support_message("ABM", InstructionSet::ABM());
267  support_message("ADX", InstructionSet::ADX());
268  support_message("AES", InstructionSet::AES());
269  support_message("AVX", InstructionSet::AVX());
270  support_message("AVX2", InstructionSet::AVX2());
271  support_message("AVX512CD", InstructionSet::AVX512CD());
272  support_message("AVX512ER", InstructionSet::AVX512ER());
273  support_message("AVX512F", InstructionSet::AVX512F());
274  support_message("AVX512PF", InstructionSet::AVX512PF());
275  support_message("BMI1", InstructionSet::BMI1());
276  support_message("BMI2", InstructionSet::BMI2());
277  support_message("CLFSH", InstructionSet::CLFSH());
278  support_message("CMPXCHG16B", InstructionSet::CMPXCHG16B());
279  support_message("CX8", InstructionSet::CX8());
280  support_message("ERMS", InstructionSet::ERMS());
281  support_message("F16C", InstructionSet::F16C());
282  support_message("FMA", InstructionSet::FMA());
283  support_message("FSGSBASE", InstructionSet::FSGSBASE());
284  support_message("FXSR", InstructionSet::FXSR());
285  support_message("HLE", InstructionSet::HLE());

298  support_message("RDRAND", InstructionSet::RDRAND());
299  support_message("RDSEED", InstructionSet::RDSEED());
300  support_message("RDTSCP", InstructionSet::RDTSCP());
301  support_message("RTM", InstructionSet::RTM());

303  support_message("SHA", InstructionSet::SHA());
304  support_message("SSE", InstructionSet::SSE());
305  support_message("SSE2", InstructionSet::SSE2());
306  support_message("SSE3", InstructionSet::SSE3());
307  support_message("SSE4.1", InstructionSet::SSE41());
308  support_message("SSE4.2", InstructionSet::SSE42());
309  support_message("SSE4a", InstructionSet::SSE4a());

312  support_message("TBM", InstructionSet::TBM());
313  support_message("XOP", InstructionSet::XOP());
314  support_message("XSAVE", InstructionSet::XSAVE());
315 
316  return 0;
317 }

◆ ReadVendorString()

◆ SeparateTo64BitValue()

string SeparateTo64BitValue ( UINT64  Value)

add ` between 64 bit values and convert them to string

Parameters
Value
Returns
string
22 {
23  ostringstream OstringStream;
24  string Temp;
25 
26  OstringStream << setw(16) << setfill('0') << hex << Value;
27  Temp = OstringStream.str();
28 
29  Temp.insert(8, 1, '`');
30  return Temp;
31 }

◆ ShowMemoryCommandDB()

void ShowMemoryCommandDB ( unsigned char *  OutputBuffer,
UINT  Size,
UINT64  Address,
DEBUGGER_READ_MEMORY_TYPE  MemoryType,
UINT64  Length 
)

Show memory in bytes (DB)

Parameters
OutputBufferthe buffer to show
Sizesize of memory to read
Addresslocation of where to read the memory
MemoryTypetype of memory (phyical or virtual)
LengthLength of memory to show
131 {
132  unsigned int Character;
133 
134  for (int i = 0; i < Size; i += 16)
135  {
136  if (MemoryType == DEBUGGER_READ_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS)
137  {
138  ShowMessages("#\t");
139  }
140 
141  //
142  // Print address
143  //
144  ShowMessages("%s ", SeparateTo64BitValue((UINT64)(Address + i)).c_str());
145 
146  //
147  // Print the hex code
148  //
149  for (size_t j = 0; j < 16; j++)
150  {
151  //
152  // check to see if the address is valid or not
153  //
154  if (i + j >= Length)
155  {
156  ShowMessages("?? ");
157  }
158  else
159  {
160  ShowMessages("%02X ", OutputBuffer[i + j]);
161  }
162  }
163 
164  //
165  // Print the character
166  //
167  ShowMessages(" ");
168  for (size_t j = 0; j < 16; j++)
169  {
170  Character = (OutputBuffer[i + j]);
171  if (isprint(Character))
172  {
173  ShowMessages("%c", Character);
174  }
175  else
176  {
177  ShowMessages(".");
178  }
179  }
180 
181  //
182  // Go to new line
183  //
184  ShowMessages("\n");
185  }
186 }

202  {

217  {

220  //

222  {
223  ShowMessages("???????? ");
224  }
225  else

229  }
230  }
231

◆ ShowMessages()

VOID ShowMessages ( const char *  Fmt,
  ... 
)

Show messages received from kernel driver.

Parameters
Fmtformat string message
53 {
54  va_list ArgList;
55  va_list Args;
56  char TempMessage[COMMUNICATION_BUFFER_SIZE + TCP_END_OF_BUFFER_CHARS_COUNT] = {0};
57 
58  if (g_MessageHandler == NULL && !g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebugger &&
59  !g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
60  {
61  va_start(Args, Fmt);
62  vprintf(Fmt, Args);
63  va_end(Args);
64  if (!g_LogOpened)
65  {
66  return;
67  }
68  }
69 
70  va_start(ArgList, Fmt);
71  int sprintfresult = vsprintf_s(TempMessage, Fmt, ArgList);
72  va_end(ArgList);
73 
74  if (sprintfresult != -1)
75  {
76  if (g_IsConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
77  {
78  //
79  // vsprintf_s and vswprintf_s return the number of characters written,
80  // not including the terminating null character, or a negative value
81  // if an output error occurs.
82  //
83  RemoteConnectionSendResultsToHost(TempMessage, sprintfresult);
84  }
85  else if (g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger)
86  {
87  KdSendUsermodePrints(TempMessage, sprintfresult);
88  }
89 
90  if (g_LogOpened)
91  {
92  //
93  // .logopen command executed
94  //
95  LogopenSaveToFile(TempMessage);
96  }
97  if (g_MessageHandler != NULL)
98  {
99  //
100  // There is another handler
101  //
102  g_MessageHandler(TempMessage);
103  }
104  }
105 }

Send the results of executing a command from deubggee (server, guest) to the debugger (client,...
Definition: remoteconnection.cpp:383
LogopenSaveToFile
VOID LogopenSaveToFile(const char *Text)
Append text to the file object.
Definition: logopen.cpp:118

VOID KdSendUsermodePrints(CHAR *Input, UINT32 Length)

BOOLEAN g_IsSerialConnectedToRemoteDebugger
Shows if the debugger was connected to remote debugger (A remote host)
Definition: globals.h:178

Shows whether the '.logopen' command is executed and the log file is open or not.

Shows whether the current system is a guest (debuggee) and a remote debugger is connected to this sys...

g_MessageHandler
Callback g_MessageHandler
The handler for ShowMessages function this is because the user might choose not to use printf and ins...

Variable Documentation

◆ g_DeviceHandle

HANDLE g_DeviceHandle
extern

Holds the global handle of device which is used to send the request to the kernel by IOCTL, this handle is not used for IRP Pending of message tracing.

  • hyperdbg
  • hprdbgctrl
  • commands.h
